Whomever converted the books to a film script needs to be forced to find an alternative career as the gaps and jumps were laughable. The "hero" goes from a precocious, whiny 12 year old to a self proclaimed master criminal in a few days with all the swagger of his co-star Colin Farrell in a Batman film.
He is without doubt the worse casting for a lead role I have ever seen 😂
Frankly do not bother with this film unless you are a sub 10 year old with the attention span of a goldfish as you will get bored with the way they have destroyed what could have been a Potter rival of a film.

This movie was absolutely awful. After loving the books for so long and waiting over a decade for a movie, I think I'm still going to be waiting. This is going to be another book to movie adaption that I pretend doesn't exist. They took the names of our beloved characters and threw their personalities and any thoughts of character development out of the window. The movie doesn't explain why Holly is suddenly friends with Artemis or the Butlers, Artemis is less of an evil genius and more of a angsty 12 year old. Did they add Artemis Sr so much just to include Colin Farrell? Poor decisions. Honestly, if you loved or even slightly liked the books, don't waste your time. Save yourself from this utter disappointment.

You can see where the money went in making this film, but this doesn't make up for the cringing awfulness of it. The dialog, the plot, the editing - truly disastrous. It's so bad it could become a cult classic.You sometimes get a glimpse of some good performances trying to get out, but they're ruined by the dreadful script.Some of the photography of Ireland is beautiful, and the music pleasant enough. But the only thing that could make this film worse would be a longer running time.

The kid (portrayed) with overinflated ego and arrogance is so repulsive. Nothing likeable about this hero/spy thing.No proper intoduction to the universe. Totally messy story telling. Mediocre acting.With all the delays in (post) production you would expect much more yet feels rushed.This is seriously one of the worst movies of the genre.

Did the people who made this abomination even read the books? They have removed all of the whimsy, humor, and general genius of the books and made the characters unrecognizable. Artemis athletic? Calling Butler by his first name? Foley isn't even sarcastic. Ridiculous.
This is a bad movie even if you have not read the books. No flow. No characters worthy of note. Horrible script. What a shame! This could have been an amazing series of movies to rival Harry Potter.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the worst screen adaptation of a great book ever.
reviews.content: I'm so disappointed in this movie all I can say is that it's fortunate that it never made it to the big screen. Disney, did you just not even try since it went straight to Disney +? Now that I think of it this movie makes me want to cancel my Disney + subscription in hope that I never have to see such a wonderful book represented so badly in a movie.

The movie is not that bad, but Artemis is just a pretentious prick. During the movie I wanted to slap him. I didn't read the book so I don't know if he supposed to act this way.
I found the cgi ok, and waiting for more. 1h38 is not enough to show of the book in a movie maybe it was the problem. They should have given more about the caractère specially the fairys. They should have dig more about their world.
Beside what a just said it is not a bad movie it just miss something.

Okay I did not read the books but I do like it.
Though a lot of comments say its a kids movie, as an adult I think it's very enjoyable. A lot of fun tech that I did not expect. The volcano travel pod, the time freeze device, the fairy wings.. love to get one of those :).
Ofc a lot of things were reminding me of other movies. E.g. the draf giganticus looked a lot like Hagrid... and a lot of the magical creatures looked like they stepped out of other fantasy/sf movies.
The cast was also good. Especially Holly is my idea of an elf and she played the role very good. The other characters are also well cast.
There is some criticism though. Although the story seemed to be told in the end, some parts feel rushed and cut short. Some scenes are okay, some too long and some too short. I think The film cut could have used some more balance.Al-in-all still very entertaining. My rating 9

There are no words to describe how bad this movie is. As a fan of the books and someone who has reread it multiple times, this movie shares absolutely nothing with the book series besides names.The storyline is non-existent and is some wierd blend of like all the books or something. The characters don't have any sort of halfway decent character arcs anymore and everything is just done wrong. Whoever directed this was obviously drunk as hell and high on weed. A bunch of high school students with a $10000 budget could make something better then this.Artemis Fowl is the Anti-Hero, but Disney made him a hero. Artemis mother is sick and father kidnapped but here his mother is dead and father is still missing. Artemis is ruthless and a criminal but he is a genius and is always the smartest one in the room. Here he is a nice kid...Holly short is the ONLY female in the LepRecon division and is paving the way for others, here her commander Julius Root has been gender swopped and is also female so that basically destroys her entire story and character arcs.Butler is Eurasian and so is Juliet, here Butler and Juliet are black(I have nothing against them being black except the fact that in the books they aren't and therefore a racial swop is completed unnecessary and adds nothing to the film)Butlers first name is such a highly guarded secret and I won't say it here(I don't want to spoil it for those who don't know it yet) in the first like 5 minutes of the movie it's made public knowledge.Anyway enough of the rant, if you're here after reading the book turn away now, if you haven't read the book yet, don't start the movie just go read the book or watch something else!
I wish I could rate this 0/10 unfortunately I can only give it a 1/10 rating.

And many other awful things this movie is. You can try and see for yourself. But if you value your time and intellect, I'd suggest you skip this. It's not even good enough to laugh about how bad it is.

reviews.review_title: If you knew nothing about it, it's not bad.
reviews.content: I went into this knowing nothing about the books and expecting it to be horrible based off of the reviews and it's not that bad. CGI is good. Worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Some of the Worst Acting you'll ever see
reviews.content: Robert Shaw was one of the world's best actors. His grandson is one of the worst. They could have cast a plank of wood and it would have given a better performance. Did they not audition any other kids? Some serious nepotism going on with this casting.Aside from good old pinnochio playing the lead and the fact it deviates from the book on so many levels it's got some good performances from Josh Gad and the young girl playing Holly Short.But my advice would be leave it. Read the books.
This movie barely qualifies as a movie. The plot has more holes than a slice of swiss cheese, the characters are blah, and the whole film is pointless. With that being said, it was entertaining.
Unimaginative plots, uninteresting characters, mediocre direction, with none of the performances work. And Josh Gad's narration is completely unnecessary and annoying. Aw-fowl.

I've never read the books just heard of them when I was a kid. I heard they were pretty good so thought me and the wife could watch the movie expecting it to be pretty decent since Disney made it. Pretty much a waste of our evening. Not trying to completely bag on the movie but it was pretty bad. It had a lot of potential and we thought it was going to be really good, the high tech fairy world, the secrets of the family, the badass butler. None of it played into any kind of follow through after that initial mention. The characters were weird, the main character that was supposed to be a genius doesn't know what to do in situations yet continually in other scenes says he has a plan. I don't know. In simple terms; character development was not there at all, no follow through in any of the cool worlds mentioned, Very disappointing actions scenes with supposedly highly trained people doing nothing, and lastly horrible transitions to next scenes. I was very lost in the movie and honestly wanted to turn it off. Stuck around just to see if there was any hope of saving it and there wasn't.

reviews.review_title: Dear lord save other great books from Disney
reviews.content: Disney has taken a beloved young adult book series and destroyed it to a point of barely being recognizable. This was bad. So so so so bad. I cringed non stop at ever scene I've seen so far. I beg anyone and every one please do not watch this and read the book. The first book will take you probably 3 hrs to read and you will love it instead of 1 1/2 of watching horrible, digested filth like this. Rot is the bowls of Hades for this one Disney

reviews.review_title: Worst movie i seen in years
reviews.content: This movie is so bad,one of the worst ever.and the storyteller wow what a bad actor worst storyteller of al time.

reviews.review_title: A jumbled mess that tried to do too much in too little time.
reviews.content: When I first saw the trailers for Artemis Fowl (2020), I was intrigued enough to pick up the book and read it. With its continual delays, I was able to also read through the first five books in the series. This may have helped me understand what Disney was trying to do with this, but it doesn't excuse their butchering of the source material. I can only imagine how confused people who hadn't read a single word of the books would be, and I was right on the verge with them.What gets me is that, as a fairly short book, Disney could have made a perfect adaptation in a scant two hours. Instead, they decided to cram so much "sequel potential" into 95 minutes to lose focus on any of the stories they were trying to adapt simultaneously. I also understand how the movie version is inclusive of all races and genders, but sometimes holding to how the characters were written in the book is the best route. After all, Judi Dench is a fine actress, but I was expecting a cigar-chomping man for Root, and not her.While there are many neat scenes in this movie, some of which are in the books, they're so disconnected that I lost interest fairly quickly. Overall, it's just kind of "meh," which might also be the source material's fault. Sure, militarized and futuristic fantasy creatures is a neat idea, but if that's all there is, then that's all there is. I will give props to Disney for cutting some of the bathroom humor that the middle-grade book chose to include for humor purposes, but now they're left with another sub-par adaptation of a beloved children's book.A jumbled mess that tried to do too much in too little time, I give Artemis Fowl 2.5 stars out of 5.
An enjoyable family movie that doesn't require a lot if thinking about, both my young children enjoyed it which is the most important thing.

reviews.review_title: Sage your childhood, don't watch this
reviews.content: Terribly dissapointing. The movie felt rushed, the dialogue was filled with one liners that made no sense. Millions of unnecessary changes to the books. Incomprehensible motivations for the characters. Why did they even mention Juliette if she was just going to be a prop, what happen with this mom? Didn't bother to explain thousands of important details. Absolutely no character development and I HATED the ending. Don't waste your time.
15 minutes is all i could take.Truly poor film making, parody laiden and cliched rubbish exposition heavy twoddle..Dont waste your life watching tripe like this.

reviews.review_title: Murdered the books and what remains was just meh
reviews.content: As an avid fan of the books as a kid the way they showed such disregard to such core parts of the characters and books already annoyed me. However ultimately the film as a whole is still floored and felt completely soulless despite some nice visuals. It didn't drag to much but felt extremely rushed, entirely predictable and worst of all I just didn't care for anyone involved. Ultimately taking away the ruining of the source material stood alone against other films there is a lot worse out there but also a lot better. I would not go out of my way to watch this and it certainly won't be wowing anyone anytime soon. Could have and should have been so much better. A travesty to such great source material to be this average.

reviews.review_title: Why? Why all the hate? This was a great way a.k.a. a new way to tell the stories of books
reviews.content: Okay yes I get it two books combined isn't the best idea for some people. But for me it was a whole new experience and the acting was fantastic. I loved every single part of it. So hate it all you want but I have a message to Kenneth Branagh and Disney: Can you please make a sequel to this?

reviews.review_title: Judging by the reviews, this one should be avoided on Disney plus.
reviews.content: Thank god it went straight to a streaming service that has grown a lot since debuting back in November 2019 with a strong slate of shows and movies and a massive back catalog. Skip this and see Harry Potter and Lord of the rings instead.

reviews.review_title: What else can I say, I mean, it was bad...
reviews.content: 'Gone Fishing' still ranks as one of the worst movies I've seen - a movie that somehow literally makes me angry while watching it, but this wasn't that bad. It was darn close though.I'm not going to rehash all the things wrong with this due to the numerous reviews that already did, but did want to add one thing:If this is what we can expect from Disney going forward - that they ruin everything they touch - then count me out.
Much anticipated new release.Endured this movie. It's plain awful, from start to finish,

reviews.review_title: A terrible movie and an even worse adaptation
reviews.content: As a movie, this would probably be a 4/10 for me. There's some decent visuals but its storyline is messy and confusing, characters are impossible to care about and the dialogue is very awkward. If you've never read or don't care about the books, this one should be avoided unless you're watching it with a child.Reviewing this as a nostalgic lover of the books though...just don't watch this. It's not worth the curiosity. They took the first two books, smashed them together with a hammer, blended them, and crapped out this movie, served with a huge helping of Random Unnecessary Plot McGuffin. Almost every scene is taken from one of the two books, but altered to be more confusing, dumb and frustrating than anything from Colfer. They don't really explain how anything works. Fairy magic is barely explained (or even used, other than healing), the Rules are brushed over extremely quickly and they keep alluding to the battle between fairies and humans without actually explaining what happened. Then there's the Aculos, a completely random magical device with absolutely no defined power that turns out to have been in Fowl Manor all along and Holly uses it perfectly to solve all the conflicts in the movie with no problems. And somehow thats not even the worst part. The characters are downright atrocious. Artemis isnt even a criminal (and also athletic for some dumb reason), his dad knows about faires and works with them to save the world, his mother is just dead, Holly is focused on redeeming her father who worked with Artemis' dad, Mulch is the most annoying and unneeded narrator ever, Root is decent but doesn't do much, Butler is just kind of there and Juliet and Foaly barely exist. Opal Koboi is supposedly behind everything but all you see is a shadow with a 3-pack-a-day voice who never does anything in the story besides be a totally generic villain who hardly ever is onscreen and barely interacts with the rest of the cast. Definitely one of the worst book adaptations I've seen, if not the absolute worst

reviews.review_title: Producer didn't respect the book or the author
reviews.content: Didn't anyone learn anything from Eragon, the movie. Producers should NEVER produce a movie based on a famous and loved line of books if you don't want to respect and recreate the books.I raised my sons on the Artemis Fowl books. We all loved the books.Sadly, little of the original book remains. A few names. Fairies. Maybe one scene. Otherwise, everything is different. Plot. Twists. Who knows what. Who's involved when. Endearing quirks. The two most blatant is Butler and Mulch Diggums. Butler was to be a solid serveant protector who defined the name Butler. Mulch Diggums was just the wrong size and never cleanly setup why he was the wrong size. I can forgive changing the gender of commander root, but still. This whole script was bad.A few special effects are good, but it's hard to watch because it doesn't match the treasured story.The story is rewritten and re-written poorly. The special effects seem more to have special effects. The fun quirkiness of the original story is just not there.

reviews.review_title: Could Have And Should Have Been Something Way Better
reviews.content: Artemis Fowl is about a young boy who is the child of the famous Artemis Fowl Senior. His dad gets kidnapped and then that sends his son sort of looking for him.I'll get right to it. This film is awful. Come on Disney, how could you? A Wrinkle In Time was bad but this was somehow worse. This is probably one of the worst films I have seen in a while.To start off, it is sooooooo boring. You think it would fill the runtime pretty well because it is only an hour and a half, but no! You never really know what is happening or what the characters are doing. That goes along with how bad the story was. They didn't even leave the house the whole film to find Artemis Fowl. They're going on a quest or something aren't they? They just had Josh Gad do voice overs for all of the character introductions which is extremely lazy. The trailer also had almost no scenes from the movie. It was like it was advertising a whole different film. I bet Disney saw how bad a lot of it was and made the director shave off half of the film. That makes me wonder how long it really is. Will people who have read the book want a directors cut? That still can't save the film from the terrible acting.The acting! Don't even get me started on the acting! The main character is atrocious! Same for all of the other characters. I bet for Collin Ferrel did this for the money. Although I don't think this film made much of anything. Judi Dench actually seemed like she cared. She did that in Cats too for I don't know what reason.The CGI was terrible as well. It looked like a kid drawing pictures of cool powers on a piece of paper for the whole film. If this film was made years ago it might even be called bad because of the CGI.Overall, Artemis Fowl showed you what it could have been but didn't take you in to see. I would recommend this film to people who are bored out of their mind and have nothing to do or people who have read the book.

Artemis Fowl
2020
12
Director: Kenneth Branagh
Starring: Josh Gad, Judi Dench, Colin Farrel, Ferdia Shaw, Nonso Anonzie, Lara Mcdonnell etcOverall rating 22/100Artemis Fowl is about a young criminal prodigy who get's unintentionally sucked into a world of magic, when a race of fairies kidnap his father. This movie was just poor, with hardly anything going for it sadly it's the worst book to movie adaptation I have seen let's get started.Let's be nice and start with a couple of positives, the film's cinematography was great, and the film linked the two main characters and their friendship well. The film looked fantastic, and their was some creativity with it's shots. With all the different species explored well, so it was pleasant to look at and if you forgot about mostly everything else about the movie it had this going for it. I did also like the way they connected Artemis (Ferdia Shaw) and Holly Short (Lara Macdonnell) the fact that both of their dad's were being wrongly accused of things they haven't done was a good way to make their friendship believable and more realistic.Now for my first two negatives. There was some very odd creative decisions throughout and the film actually had fairly poor CGI in places. I thought some off the creative decisions they made in the movie really didn't work for me at all. Largely the odd on and off narration from Josh Gad when he was being questioned about Artemis Fowl, we hadn't even met his character and we had him talking over the movie and it just didn't work until the actual scene of his escape happened, the film had multiple bad and confusing creative choices that didn't work.My next negatives would be the lack of character background, the film being overstuffed with characters with no development and the lack of connection with the relationships. The movie just expected you to know the characters and what they do before they even explained it, for people who haven't read the books, they would want to get to know the characters as they would be new to them so this was poor. The film also had way to many characters with practically no background or development just the basic role within the film. Because of the previous two negatives I didn't have any connection with most of the relationships throughout. I didn't really believe or connect with the father and son relationship between Artemis and his dad (Colin Farrell) it just felt awkward and forced which is not something that should happen with family relationships within the film. I also felt emotional disconnect with the characters. Because of my lack of connection to the father and son dynamic it was very hard for me to feel bad for Artemis about his father or even when they reunited. And when the butler (Nonso Anonzie) died I didn't feel any emotion at all because I knew practically nothing about his character.My final two positives would be the decent amount of character background and information about Artemis at the beginning and the performances from Josh Gad and Judi Dench. When they actually spent some time giving us background on Artemis and a bit of development it was appreciated. We learned about Artemis and his personality and how he doesn't fit in at school because of the bad image his father has, it made you understand his character a little bit more, I also appreciated the performances and the character work done by Josh Gad and Judi Dench. Two professional and good actors, we will get into the negative performances shortly. Both their characters were very likeable, and they both went all out with their performances which was really appreciated and showed how professional and experienced they both are, which in a weird way made them out of place in the film.My next two negatives would be the bad performances and how generic the movie was. I really felt like most of the performances within the film were either bad or just seemed like the actors didn't really care. No offense to Ferdia Shaw as this is his first professional role and I partly blame the script but he was terrible as the main character. His inexperience was obvious, he was awkward to watch and always looked like he was waiting for everyone to finish their lines, even Lara's performance as Holly felt slightly amateurish. Plus the movie was so generic and predictable it took a lot of the fun out of it. You knew what was going to happen at the end. And some of the choices were so obvious it was just bad, and the Artemis's story of not fitting in and having a lost parent has been done so many times before, the plot just lacked creativity and uniqueness.My next negatives would be the rushed pacing, inconsistent storytelling, and tonal issues with poor attempts at humour. The film felt completely rushed and never settled on one particular thing. It just felt like it was constantly changing its mind about the plot, and the film just needed to be longer in order to flesh and further develop the plot and at least some of the characters. The storytelling was also inconsistent and messy, we spent more time in the fairy world then actually focused on the main characters, this was frustrating as this was also just poor worldbuilding as they didn't spend an equal amount of time fleshing out both worlds. There was some severe tonal issues as well, they were trying to add normal things from the world we live in into a movie about goblins and fairies and it just didn't work I found all the pop culture references irritating and out of place. These were largely the films attempts at humour and for me it just didn't work.My next two negatives would be the poor script and the underwhelming reveal. The whole script for me just felt very poorly put together and to be honest fairly lazy. The plot was generic, the characters within the script were poorly fleshed out, and the film just felt like it needed a few more drafts as for me this was not up to the standard of what the film should have been. Also, the underwhelming reveal of the object that Artemis needed to find was disappointing. The fact that the movie made such a big deal about finding an artefact for the villain so he could save his dad only for it to be in the house was for me a lazy creative choice. And made parts of the movie a complete waste of time.My final negatives would be the poor villains, underusage of characters and poorly trying to set up a sequel. The villains of the film first of all were hardly involved, and when they were they never really posed a threat at all which considering what they were up against was incredibly disappointing. Sometimes not knowing anything about a villain's past or what they look like is a good thing but sadly not in this case. And in general, there was just a lot of underused characters, especially Artemis's dad which was a shame as it made him be less important despite him being the one who inspired Artemis. And finally, the film really lazily set up for a sequel. I hope this doesn't get a sequel, I knew all the thing they were going to say they still needed to do, and due to my disconnect to the movie I just didn't care that much.Overall Artemis Fowl looked amazing, but apart from that was a poor movie. That just felt inconsistent, generic and rushed. And sadly, should not be the start of a new franchise.

reviews.review_title: Wow haven't see a movie this good in a while
reviews.content: A well developed story but it feels like this is only the first part of the story to come. Well done and lots of beautiful locations. This was made so well I wouldn't mind watching it again. Also Judi Dench is amazing in this movie. Yes this isn't the typical movie but it's different and that's what makes it good. Yet this is my opinion and not everyone will agree with me and I am fine with that. Don't write all the hate about it. Which is so easy for us as humans to do. Focus on what you liked instead.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant. These amateur critics have no idea.
reviews.content: This film was absolutely fantastic. Never read the books but now seriously thinking of reading them. All these bad reviews are written by viewers who obviously have no clue what they are writing. These people saying Artemis is obnoxious are being small minded, he is not obnoxious, he isn't enjoying school because he isn't being challenged and the school aren't giving him a chance. Don't listen to the bad reviews and watch the film. If you don't get it, don't make it seem like a terrible film. Listen to the good reviews. if you have read the books and put a bad review, fair enough, but for me, somebody who has never read the books I'm seriously considering reading them because of the film.

reviews.review_title: Never read the book, but it was awful.
reviews.content: If there was an award for the most confusing film ever made and with the most annoying cast, Artemis Fowl would win in a heartbeat. This is nothing like the book as far as I read and the plot just jumps around all over the place so you don't even know what the hell is even going on, it makes sense when you realized they just tried to squeeze 3 or 4 books into this hour and thirty minute movie (And there are eight books, which I'm assuming they were planning to make a second movie. But since this flopped HARD I doubt there would even be another one). And they have the most annoying cast ever, I really like Josh Gad but I don't understand why he was even narrating this dumpster fire. Lara McDonnell as Holly Short is just awful, her character looks like if one of the bugs from Best Fiends was sent to radioactive laboratory and was genetically modified with Young Mary Katherine from Epic (2013). Overall, this film is really confusing. Stay away from this and just watch The Falcon and the Winter Solider it's hundred times better than this sorry state of a movie. Shame on them from ruining Eoin Colfer's books...

At first I was happy to see a new Disney fantasy movie, but the little boy is extremely annoying from the beginning and almost unbearable and simply ridiculous. I just had to finish the film again. What a pity.

My bad. I was entertained and enjoyed the film, falling in love with Holly Short. I have not read the books so I don't know what a hit job they did on adaptation. I saw this as Ireland's answer to Harry Potter in a magical world of faeries, trolls, dwarfs, and goblins. The production is geared to early teens of both genders. It is not overly dark, but then neither was the first Potter film.If you haven't read the books and don't have any expectations, you might find yourself scratching your head at the negative reviews.

reviews.review_title: Can I give it NEGATIVE STARS?!? This movie is HORRIBLE!
reviews.content: I'm 20 minutes into the movie.I turned it off.The character Artemis in the movie, IS NOTHING LIKE the character in the book.Same with ALL the other characters!The story doesn't even TRY to parallel.The world setting grabbed bits from the book, and parodied them.THIS IS HORRIBLE!

reviews.review_title: Far from Fowl Everyone, More like Awesome
reviews.content: I get it everyone is a critic even established career going film critics.Yes this movie was originally given the go ahead in 2001. So why the 19 year wait?!I have never heard of nor read the books this is based on. I had only ever watched the one trailer they released a few months back. I was actually intrigued at the time.As soon as I heard Disney+ was going to release it to their platform I was stoked since movie theatres are closed due to Covid-19.Then as June 12 rolled round and RT released the reviews I honestly couldn't believe it! 11% on RT?!Ignoring that fact as best I could I switched it on, and well I don't understand all the hate. But hey each to their own. I was anticipating a disaster but instead got a great sci-fi fantasy film with cool CGI, characters and easy enough to follow story.Honestly I didn't expect it to be remotely good based on the writers past material, but I was very impressed. At a breezy 95min it delivered pure fun entertainment and judging by the end I darn well hope there'd better be more!!Kenneth Branagh directed this thing better than I imagined. At first I was skeptical but hey it pulled it off. Now let's hand it off to Taika Waititi for the sequels.Overall I was personally impressed. Again I haven't read the books so I can't compare.Looking forward to more- I hope!!

This was a wonderful fun and exciting mix between science fiction and The age old fairytales. It definitely left me wanting more and more and more. I hope they turn it into a series. Because there is so much more they can tell. The special effects the magic and the storyline were awesome. I'm a 40-year-old man and I enjoyed it.
This movie is fit for all ages. I am going to put it on as a family night movie I think my two-year-old daughter will love it and my 18-year-old daughter will definitely enjoy it. Have fun and thank you Disney for creating such a wonderful family friendly movie.

reviews.review_title: Bland but fine if you are drunk and not paying attention too much
reviews.content: I have to say that I never read the original source so I can't compare this with it. I can only give my opinion regarding the movie. I feel like the plot was rushed way too much. You get the main points,the villain,a glimpse into the fairy world and stuff like that but you don't get a more complex reason why stuff is happening on the screen. The plot is somehow coerent but lacks deepness and emotion in general. I personally can't get attached to any of the characters. It's really sad how a great actress went from Bond movies to this kind of movie. If I wasn't half assed drunk and doing something else while playing the movie I would've dropped it after the first half hour. Too bad that the idea had potential but they ruined it really bad(Percy Jackson type of bad)

reviews.review_title: Thank you, Disney, for ruining this great series of books with this atrocious movie.
reviews.content: Dear God, what a waste of time. There really isn't anything else to say.

reviews.review_title: Felt more like the BEGINNING of a movie...
reviews.content: Honestly, the acting was great, the CGI was very nice, and the story was so-so. I'm not comparing it to the books because I don't care. What bothered me though was that the whole thing felt like the beginning of a movie, instead of a full movie. The credits rolled and I was just sitting there thinking "wait... that's it?", and because of that it felt like I'd wasted my time. It just feels incomplete, and that makes me sad because I was really looking forward to this release :/

For starters,I haven't read the novel and haven't heard about Artemis Fowl before the release of the trailer. So,this review is purely based on movie aspects.This movie is about Artemis Fowl(Ferdia Shaw),a 12 year old genius boy,who is a descendant of long line of criminal masterminds. His father gets kidnapped by a hooded guy and he needs the powerful "Aculos" inorder to return Artemis Fowl Sr(Colin Farrell). But soon,he has to face the powerful underground fairies who has connection with the Aculos and the missing of his father.Firstly,some of the visuals in this movie are great. That's it.To sum it up,this movie was pretty bad. They had a good source material and didn't even utilize a bit. There wasn't any story in this actually,the movie starts and within a few minutes,the whole movie is set up, there's no tension,the pacing is bad, everything happens so quick and you won't even see any character development in it. This movie is only 95 minutes long and they accomplish nothing in it. The acting was bad,some of the costumes were bad and there's no emotion in this movie. There are several movies where there's no character development or story,but, we'll be atleast entertained. Sadly,this movie is not entertaining.Overall,as I said,this is a bad movie, maybe if they spent more time in development or increased the runtime with more content,it might've been alot better. In frank,this $125M movie is not worth a watch for normal movie viewers. For fans,it would be a disgrace.
This had nothing to do with the books or even related to it. C'mon Disney you've done better

reviews.review_title: Did they even read the series?
reviews.content: Not only does this movie try to shove 3-4 books into an 1 hour 35 minutes, it doesn't even follow the story. Artemis is not a good kid. When we first meet him in the books, he is a criminal already. One of the amazing things about the series is how Artemis is redeemed by the end of it.And the relationship being all lovey with his dad? READ THE BOOKS!!I could go on and on, but why? This movie is horrible and an utter disappointment after waiting so long for someone to make it.Don't bother if you loved the books.

Turned it off 45mins in, I'm surprised I lasted that long. Disney have ulterly decemated this movie, I think they realised this early and rather than reshoot decided to promo heavily and put the only good scenes into the trailers. Wooden acting, ridiculously fast paced story line, no investment into the characters. Urgh just urghhhhh.

reviews.review_title: I can't understand the bad reviews
reviews.content: I can't understand the bad reviews, well I don't know the books, but Jurassic Park didn't really stick to the book either. Everything was new to me, of course, so I didn't have any particular expectations. I thought the film was great and I hope there will be a second part, despite the bad reviews.

reviews.review_title: Loved it - sick of the hate....
reviews.content: I love IMDB as it has always really helped me to know if something is worth watching. However recently I have noticed a lot more negative reviews for movies / programs that I do not think are that bad.I have not read the books so I am not evangelical on Artemis but for me this is a 6.5 / 7 rating in reality.I don't touch below 5 normally but I was so looking forward to this and therefore could not believe the rating - so tried it anyway and so glad I did.I know it is subjective to a certain level but this is not a below 5 rating movie - give it a chance.

It wasn't as good as the book although I never read the book. You know how I know that it wasn't as good as the book then? Because they're NEVER as good as the book. I can't believe people still go into movies expecting them to be like the book. Worse thing to put in a review... Ever!There are a lot of holes in this movie from an adult perspective but the way I see it this is a kids movie and I think kids are going to enjoy it. It doesn't seem to do what so many Disney movies do these days and try to cater to both adults and kids. It's all for the kids and there's nothing wrong with that.Acting was ehhhh... Special effects were ehhhh... It looks like it was filmed with 3D in mind and I would have enjoyed seeing the world they created with the depth of 3D.All that being said I didn't regret the hour and a half I spent watching it. I still have a little kid left in me. Sure there's better out there... But being locked up for this pandemic for the last 3 months I can tell you I've watched many that were worse. Don't expect the book... Don't expect an academy award... Just stick the kids in front of the TV for an hour and a half and have a glass of wine.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable movie but made no sense.
reviews.content: My wife and I enjoyed it, but it made no sense.Some very well done scenes. Interesting concept, just not well executed. It didn't flow well, but ignoring that it was quite entertaining.I didn't read the novels, so I May be less critical if it than those who have.Others criticized the acting, but I thought it was fine. Certainly compared to Harry Potter's young actors as a comparison.CGI was fine as well, but not up to $125 million standards.Bottom line. We were entertained and wouldn't mind a sequel. But, that won't happen with the reviews it received.Obviously disappointed fanboys are trashing it overly much. But, they needed to make them happy as well.

reviews.review_title: A movie which might serve its purpose?!
reviews.content:
Tins of bad reviews... but I guess the problem is, that the movie is rated mostly by two types: serious fantasy movie buffs and b) readers of the book, which expect a closer adaptation.
I read and watched a lot of bad reviews - and then I gave it myself a go. The grotesk colors, "technologies, cinematographia, costume design and so on, gave me already in the first minutes the impression: this movie isn't meant to be a serious movie. It wants to be light family entertainment.So I watched it exactly with this premise and the movie didn't really disappointed. Yeah, it is a bit boring, but which movie which is appropriate for smaller children isn't?Does that make the movie a masterpiece? Nope for sure not. But it isn't as inherently bad as most people want you to believe. It is almost an injustice to rate this movie as bad as many have done.If you have a family with young children and want to watch something, which is totally innocent, but also kinda contemporary... this is the movie for you... for others: just pass this one!

reviews.review_title: If you love the books you'll probably hate the movie
reviews.content:
Like Ready Player One, the movie has been changed so much from the books it's unrecognisable to anyone who has read the books, but unlike Ready Player One, this movie is not good.
Without even judging the movie on the changes made from the book, it is just badly made and I expected a lot more form someone like Kenneth Branagh. Judi Dench looks like she doesn't even know why she is there or what she is saying. The only actor that put in a decent performance was the one playing Holly Short. The other performances are average at best, with some being a bit over the top and distracting. There was one moment at the end of the film where Colin Farrell seems to changes seats in the helicopter 3 or 4 different times, which to me is a cardinal sin when you are making a big blockbuster movie costing millions of dollars. The worst part of all is that the author Eoin Colfer actually was happy with the movie and had some say in it even though it barely resembles his books. Disney is really scraping the bottom of the barrel to bring out new content for their streaming service.I don't even know where to start with the stupid changes from the book that just cause distractions....
A 12 year old criminal mastermind who only ever wears a suit becomes a 12 year old whining boy who likes to surf
A highly trained bodyguard who never reveals his real name unless he is dying as that is part of his training, has everyone call him by his real name, and cries a lot
The bodyguards 18 year sister who has been through the same training as him, becomes his 12 year old niece who runs around screaming in terror the whole time even though she is trained in all sorts of martial arts
Commander Root changes from a grumpy old man who doesn't think a female elf should be part of LEP-Recon to a caring grumpy old woman
Holly Short becomes a over-emotional teenage fairy
And that's just the main ones I can remember in my state of disbelief at the badness of this film

Dame Judy and Sean Connery now have one thing in common, they have both acted in truly dreadful leprechaun movies.The lead fairy isn't bad, Farrell is okay (poor bloke), but the other acting is grim. In fact the whole movie is one Grimm fairy tale. Avoid.

reviews.review_title: Seriously people...stop giving it a one because you read the book🙄
reviews.content: Simmer down people. I have read the books too but your vision and Kenneth Branagh's vision are different. This is not a great movie, but it is still a good one. It's a solid 7 but I rated it higher because of these silly people giving it a one. I liked it.
Most reviews from adults that liked the book and not the movie. The kids loved this and is one of their favourites.

I read the books years ago. This is "Artemis Fowl" in name only.Dialogue is flimsy, CGI is cheap, acting is weak, storyline is incoherent. Not to bash the fresh actors but the main character cast could use a lot of work. Worst of all, the books contain all the lore, tech, character development, and explanation a director could wish for, but they discarded it all. Incentives were unclear and characters existed in places they should not have.One of THE MOST INTERESTING pieces of character development in the books is the relationship between Artemis and Butler. I will say, I was highly disappointed in that regard.I really liked the books, and remember the story well and fondly even though I read them nearly 10 years ago. I will forget this movie.

I first read some reviews before watching this, with majority of them being bad reviews and I decided to give it a go. My opinion is, if you go in expecting a family fun Disney movie then it's great, just as a Disney movie should be. Don't listen to the harsh reviews, watch it and you won't be disappointed.

When your 9 year old son turns to you and says, 'is that it?' at the end of the film, you know you are in trouble. The attempts at humour were not funny, the plot was virtually non existent. No imagination whatsoever. A total waste of a great cast, let down by a bland script and unimaginative direction.

I woke up this morning thinking about how bad this movie was. It was just boring!! A real snooze fest. It's really too bad because I was excited about this movie. It looked like a fun family movie, and those are scarce these days. I gave you two stars because it could have been a good movie, but it literally put me to sleep. Halfway through I was ready to turn it off and go to bed, but my 11-year-old daughter seemed as if she was enjoying it. I tried to stay up for her because she was asking questions, that I cannot answer because I was too busy wanting to go to sleep. I don't know I always agree with the reviews on this site, but here for this movie they are definitely indicative of what you have to look forward to, just straight up boredom. It's really a shame, Disney I hope you do better next time. Can we have a good family movieThat won't put everyone to sleep?
If I had read the books, I might not have liked this but I didn't read them. I thought that the movie was pretty entertaining.

First let me say that I have not read the books. Second let me say that even if I had read the books, this movie is dIsappointing. No character development, no emotional investment, scattered and minimal plot, uninspired performances, sketchy visual effects, the list goes on. Even the grand dame Judy Dench couldn't make this work. The only performance I actually felt was believable was Colin Farrell and I understand he only spent three days filming. At least HE didn't waste a lot time on it. The fairy world seemed plastic and stiff, more technological than magical. I think they spelled the last name In the title wrong...should have been foul...not fowl. Very disappointing Kenneth and Disney.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the haters, excellent family adventure movie!!
reviews.content: As usual the insane book readers get mad AGAIN!! Definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results. Every time they watch a movie based on a book they complain!!! DONT expect them to be the same its impossible, judge based on entertainment value. This movie has its flaws , the lead actor is weak he is no Daniel Radcliffe but other than that, decent story, decent acting, decent effects and a very good ending and to those who cant follow the story quit drinking so much alcohol while watching. This is a great watch for a family who wants a excellent adventure.

I must say that the first 40 minutes seemed ok, I've not read the books but apart from a really wooden performance by the main character the story was moving along fine.But then it seemed like much of the story was cut and disconnected.I must say that I really didn't care about any of the Characters apart from Mulch Diggums.Overall considering the budget, director and the fact it's a Disney movie I felt very disappointed.

Artemis Fowl is discount Harry Potter. Or the diet Pepsi of Harry Potter. Or the new coke crystal flavor of soda. At least the Wizarding World is able to sustain eight movies across a viable franchise. I've never read the Artemis Fowl series, I only know them through osmosis, but it has a series of books, a solid fan base and franchise potential bubbling just beneath the surface, but based on this stinker, fat chance of that happening. It feels a like there's at least half an hour missing from the movie, which sits at an hour and half length, rather surprising, considering the state of recent blockbusters, and the usual length of Kenneth Branagh's filmography. At least he's got Patrick Doyle in his back pocket doing a rather good score. On the side is some good costumes, production design and a tease at an interesting magical world, but that's pretty much it; everything else had all the fun sucked out. It has kids who kind of act in it, except when they can't, sometimes in the exact same scene. Josh Gad pops in as discount Hagrid, doing a mumbly, gravely voice that feels like he's trying to impersonate a grizzled detective in a crime show. Then Judi Dench pops in doing her McGruff the crime dog imression, and then the villain pops in who talks like he's using the voice modulator from the Scream movies. All I could think of when he was talking was, "Do you like scary movies, Artemis?" The grating voice narration takes up half the movie, and felt like Christian Bale's Batman got caught in the throat of a hippo. I guess I'm not supposed to be laughing when a dark elf in a Emperor Palpatine robe and hoodie is talking into a magical iPhone, reading off dialogue that sounds like what a six year old would say to sound cool. Thanks for wasting a good premise Disney. At least you can go down in history as having one of the most boring, unexciting finales ever. It's flat like my soda, with some bland CGI on the side. All the fans of the book seemed to be up in arms and hated the trailer, and the movie as well, now I know why. There goes another viable franchise that had potential; just add it the growing pile of things that could've been great.

It's really impressive when I watch something with my niece who manages to sit through anything I put on... 10 minutes in she says, "Can we watch Spongebob I hate this". I have never been so relieved because I was dumbfounded on what was on my screen.Disney should be happy this didn't go to theaters... just wow.
Curse you Disney. See for yourself, or, don't. All I can say if you read the books - you will be disappointed.

Guaranteed to ruin your day. About 1 minute in, I thought the writing was utter poo. Narration is such a cheap tactic to vomit plot details, sorry Josh Gad but you're horrible as Hagrid II. Art direction and costumes are a complete cliche and total disaster. I expected SOOOOO much more from Kenneth Branagh! Judi Dench's agent's been a Real twat to her this past year, file under CATS which at least had a catchy tune here & there. Hurts to know this was even made. Ew ALL over it. Barely deserves the 1 star!!!
This might be the worst movie I've see since the live action attempt at "The Last Air Bender" Didn't even bother to finish it with 15 min left.

Disney have sadly given into virtue signalling.
Honestly this movie was so bad even my 9 year old daughter was happy to turn it off 30 mins in.Disney magic is dead.

Even my 10 and 11 year old boys (Who had read the books) were criticising this Very poor effort all the way through, and I couldn't help but agree with them. I was hoping for this movie to be at least palatable for me and my wife to watch too, but how wrong can you get? I'm sure my sentiments are echoed in other reviews, but given the talent involved in this production, it really should have been a winner and this certainly does not warrant a sequel of any sort. The boy playing Artemis was just not up to the job, which is not his fault at all, but the casting director should never work again in my opinion.
I love Kenny and Dame Judy Stench usually, but they should hang their heads in shame for being involved in this travesty.
Maybe the Disney execs buggered it all up, but whatever happened it should be a lesson to all involved.

reviews.review_title: The movie was amazing. Do t compare it to the books and you and your children will love it too!

YOU HAD AMAZING SOURCE MATERIAL, WHYYYYYYY???This will never be anything big or noteworthy, and this series dies in its printed form. Very, very sad and disappointing. This is not Artemis Fowl.

reviews.review_title: There is one good reason I can rate this movie 10 stars
reviews.content: I loved the movie, because I saw it as a child, without expecting anything at all. A child whose heroes were on the screen, like that time you saw Santa Claus on the tv.It was severely flawed, on not being able to make audience feel what they should feel on each situation, by developing an extremely superficial fast-paced tornado of a confusing altered plot.But I watched it with my inner child, the one who doesn't judge if it's father who puts the beard on and the red hat to give me presents.This movie is a gift, and I'm grateful for it. I'll watch it happily until I get the remake.Hope my review helps.I gave it a 10/10 for the feelings I have felt when I watched the movie, as a fan of the Artemis Fowl series of books who waited for 20 years for this. Objectively, I would give the movie a 7/10 being kind, and a 4/10 being mean. 7 would be just right though.The thing is, the real problem with the movie is it's too fast paced. They tried to push two and a half books into one movie and they were way too rich to do it this way. Other than that, the plot is way different and some of the characters are way out of character, which makes it hurtful for less understanding fans, which is not my case.But you've probably have read too many rants and hate towards the movie, so I will state the very brilliant points of it, which makes it a great movie despite its flaws.1) The actings are fantastic, all of them. Despite the screenplay which made them feel out of character, they did an amazing job with what they had.2) The visuals are marvelous. I absolutely couldn't have expected anything better, and it exceded my expectations entirely and by far. I am very happy with what I saw. Wonderful science fiction visuals.3) Make up and the clothing was brilliant. I can't ask for anything better.4) Cinematography and photography is amazing.5) As a fan of AF, I watched it as a "parallel universe", since it was different to the real (and much better) plot of the books, and was satisfied with the altered plot.Now the 3 main flaws which made the movie be a 4 star movie instead of a decent 8 star one:1) Extremely fast paced that pushes way too many interesting things in seconds, so nobody can fully immerse on this new fairy world thus making something otherwise brilliant feel superficial and lame2) A screenplay favoring out of character acting3) Ok, I'll say it. The book plot was tremendously better.I really enjoyed watching a decent movie of my main childhood book series and I'll watch it at least 20 more times this week. I hope on some miracle there comes a second one -or even better: a remake.

reviews.review_title: Bears No Resemblance to the Source Material
reviews.content: "Artemis Fowl" the movie is an abomination. It bears such little resemblance to the source material that if it weren't for the character's names you would have no idea it was based on the "Artemis Fowl" book franchise. Make no mistake, I am not talking about small variances, but rather a plot that was entirely rewritten from scratch. Why this was done is beyond me, as the original book was cinematic in nature, although everything that made the book interesting and cinematic was thrown out the door in this movie. Not even the characters were spared -- with massive changes made to their appearances, ages, personalities, and living situations.I used to think the Divergent film franchise was as large as you could deviate from your source material, but Artemis Fowl has proven me wrong. Whoever wrote this screenplay clearly has an enormous ego that led them to believe they had the talent to completely dismantle the source material and that fans would enjoy it. Clearly they were wrong.

This movie isn't like the books in any ways, and it's not for the better.
They changed a lot of the story and tried to squish two books into one. I thought disney had learned from their mistakes with percy jackson 2.
For some reason they made Artemis Fowl empathatic as hell, even though he was the most disconnected kid in the books you could ever imagine (even consumed by greed).
They changed personalities, they changed events, they even have the audacity to give the movie a different moral than the books.
This movie also shows that age appropriate casting and good special effects don't mean that the movie is going to be good too.
I can't even describe how much is wrong with this movie.
I did not understand the movie... It was really bad... Pretty sure the bad guy/lady is his mom

reviews.review_title: The making of "Artemis Fowl" on its own deserves a motion picture.
reviews.content:
Who do you think you are?
I'm the next criminal mastermind.I'm afraid you need to be as intelligent as "Artemis Fowl" to understand and keep up with this movie. What a confusing chaos this was. I get it that they are looking for a sort of Harry Potter successor and already started drooling while thinking of the box-office with every new sequel. But they should have spread this single movie over a number of sequels because now you cannot make heads or tails of it. Let me remind you that I don't know the book series written by Eoin Colfer, on which this film is based. Let alone read one of them. A kind of introduction of the characters would have been helpful for the uninitiated viewers. And that's a big difference when you compare (and there will be a lot of comparisons) this Disney film with the Harry Potter films. Even if you hadn't read one of the Harry Potter books, you were sucked into the wonderful story about this mini wizard from the start. All the leading protagonists were carefully introduced and gradually you got to know them, appreciate them, and quickly one of the leading characters became your favorite. With "Artemis Fowl" you better keep focused because before you know it you have missed a whole storyline and a number of important characters. The amount of facts and things of importance is so immense that it'll make you dizzy.It also took an awful lot of effort before the film could be released. The film rights were bought in 2001 by Miramax Films (in the middle of the fantasy film period when Potter and Frodo ruled). Next Disney announced in 2013 that they were going to make the film in partnership with The Weinstein Company. The creation of this feature film was very different from what had been expected. First of all, you had the disappearing trick of some directors. Then there was the Weinstein affair with Harvey waving his wand too much apparently. Next came the disgruntled fans and last but not least the Coronavirus. In the end, it was decided to stream the film on the Disney + platform instead of screening in the cinema. For sure this was the best decision they could have ever made. No one would be inclined to watch it in the cinema after reading a few reviews. Unfortunately, the revenue from Disney + platform subscriptions is not enough to bear the price tag of a sloppy $ 125 million.What else went wrong besides the fact it's a very confusing story? Well, to be honest, I wasn't really charmed by the characters themselves. Artemis Fowl Jr. (Ferdia Shaw) is an annoying kid without any charisma and totally insensitive (A kind of MIB version of Richie Rich). A deadly serious little brat with an attitude. Admittedly, his intelligence is lightyears beyond normal and he obtained a series of diplomas at a very young age. Plus he comes from a wealthy family and probably took everything for granted during his young life. The magic of a film doesn't only depend on the magic of the story itself, but also how amiable the main characters come across. No one could resist the charms of Harry Potter (I know. There's the comparison again.): that poor little fellow living under the stairs, with his roguish smile and lightning bolt on his forehead. I really didn't find Artemis that charming. And even the more famous actors made little impression. Colin Farrell had a depressed and sulky expression throughout the film as if he already saw the potential for disaster. Judi Dench was actually the only one to stand out in her green leather fairy outfit. But that was more because of the charismatic nature of her character Commandant Root. And Lara McDonell looked adorable as the brave fairy Holly Short. You also had a centaur who could join Milli Vanilli. The dwarf Mulch Diggums (Josh Gad), who also took on the role of narrator at the same time, who's actually not a dwarf and resembles Rubeus Hagrid. And there was even the suggestion David Bowie was an elf (Talking bout humor). That's about it what I can remember from all personages. In general, however, the performances were not impressive or grand.There's also something to be said about the footage. They've put a lot of energy into it (maybe a little too much) and the film is packed with generally good-looking CGI. But a film about fairies, trolls, and dwarfs, who live in an underground hidden world, must look fairy-like and enchanting to me. They've decided to create a futuristic-looking fairy world full of flashy vehicles and modern buildings. And stuffed with a bunch of extras, busy decors, and an infinite number of props that you'll need an extra pair of eyes to take in all the wonders. But don't panic. This magical place is soon abandoned. Most of the film is set in the residence of the Fowl family. And there you can expect even more CGI (slightly less well developed). Perhaps it was quite an exaggeration when you consider the number of special effects. The only thing that impressed me was the jaw joints of Mulch Diggums.No, I'm not a new fan of "Artemis Fowl" and I don't feel the urge to discover the books. All in all, I found this movie version confusing and chaotic. I sometimes had the feeling that I was watching a new episode of "Kingsman" for young viewers. I didn't fully understand the principle of the time bubble and was amazed bout how Artemis could unravel everything so quickly (But yes, extremely intelligent. Right?). Maybe me being a grownup has something to do with it. I guess youngsters will like it. Although, I think my two kids, who aren't real book readers and never heard of Artemis Fowl, will be lost after 20 minutes. A re-watch might help better understanding the whole thing. I imagine fans of the books were very curious how Fowl's world would look like on the silver screen. Anyway. I won't wait for the sequels of this vague film. To put it mildly, I think the movie "Artemis Fowl" is a perfect fit for the current summer vacation that has become a disaster due to COVID-19.
Lame Harry Potter type of idea thing. Except for worse story and hammy acting. Better than nothing if stuck indoors with children. Many TV shows are actually much better. Meh.

I heard about this movie a month or so ago. I put it in my mind, to watch. I was excited that it was out and on Disney +. Here are my thoughts.First, I have fantastic hearing. But, I had a hard time hearing what the characters were saying. The audio was low. Plus, they always had music playing in the background. Once, I actually said out loud, "stop with the music already!"Then, the movie is a total mess. I mean, there are SO many things going on, that it is hard to find the main point. There was no focus.The acting was not that great from some of the cast.The movie drug on and on and on. I mean, even after the thirty minute mark, I was ready to watch something else. But, I told myself that it may get better. I was wrong.The graphics were great. It looked like I was watching an A-list movie. It was a shame that such a good looking movie, was drug down but such an awful script.Honestly, I have watched so many movies in my life. This one, by far, is the one of the most boring, pointless, never gets to a point, lacks focus, is never entertaining wastes of time, I have ever watched.Kids MAY like it. But, there are a few things in it that may frighten them.This is the second Disney + movie I have watched and the second that I thought was bad.

reviews.review_title: "It's a kid's movie" is not a good excuse
reviews.content: Let's make this clear. I'm still a kid. Or at least, I'm not yet a legal adult. More importantly, I love and openly enjoy kids movies every time, movies like Onward, How To Train Your Dragon, Sonic the Hedgehog, Christopher Robin etc. This movie is nothing like the ones I've mentioned above.This movie is a massive dumpster fire, and that's even before I add in my complaints as a book fan.First, let's talk the movie without the context of the books. I hate to say this, but Ferdia Shaw is quite unconvincing as an actor, and that's partly down to the rubbish script he was given as much as it is his wooden delivery. Secondly, the plot of this movie is everywhere except coherent. From plot point to plot point it's rushed to be "exciting" when instead it's just barely understandable, a blast of CGI after CGI with no real stakes or drama or proper characters who you even like. It's a mixture of B-movie cliches that takes this admittedly well-made fairy world and makes it entirely forgettable and generic. Humour falls flat just about every time. I'm going to quote Chris Stuckmann, who has not read the books, and who does routinely review movies like the aforementioned Onward and HTTYD, "stunningly bad". Josh Gad's narration was such a bore. The setup of this movie's world is ridiculously generic which results in a severe disinterest in the movie in of itself. The characters are equally boring.In order to have some touchstone to the book, you hear them say the line that he's a "criminal mastermind". Let's be clear. Artemis spends the movie being a very nonthreatening occasionally smart kid. On no occasion is the criminal angle ever brought up in a meaningful way. You can't have it both ways, this only furthers how atrocious the writing of this movie was.Let's get into the book argument. The premise of the books was that Artemis Fowl began as a criminal mastermind who did criminal things like blow up boats, kidnap and extort, and who eventually would have a redemption arc. By starting from the opposite direction, the writers have not only failed entirely to adapt the singular unique thing about Artemis Fowl, but also created an even more unconvincing arc than before. As mentioned already, the plot is everywhere and the stakes are artificially thrown everywhere and muddled to make it feel like something is happening.The reason why the Fowl books were good was also because the plotting was relatively tight and fast-paced. Two different arcs were squished into this 90 minute movie, making the plot incoherent, especially when compared to the original books.Yes, books will always have differences from movies and that's absolutely fine. But there is no real excuse for the writers. Namely because there are graphic novels of the original books. What does this mean? It means that an entire storyboard already exists. The hardest work is essentially done for you, by showing you a visual format of the plot, so it's easy to decide what you can film and what you can't. To then come up with a generic plot and the most ridiculous character arcs for a series which had good versions of both was stupid.Finally, let's address the "it's a kids movie" nonsense. Any five year old will enjoy a random mixture of colours and cool-looking creatures. This is NOT an excuse to make a shit movie. It's barely enjoyable, and let's face it, not even interesting enough to get you to consider watching another one. It isn't even as though Disney did families a favour by making this generic entertainment. The original was written for kids. Read by kids. Enjoyed by kids, who usually have a deeper appreciation of things like that than adults give them credit for. It makes zero sense that making Artemis Fowl slowly turn evil is somehow a better character arc for audiences than starting with an already somewhat evil Artemis. The characters don't fit, and anyway Shaw is highly unconvincing at being anything more than a wide-eyed kid with occasional smart moments.Enough with that nonsense to justify a high score. reviews.review_title: What a sad waste of $125 million dollars
reviews.content: In Covid times, we have nothing but time. I regret every minute lost on this utter abomination. If there were a way to leave negative stars, I would.I'm a mom of 3 sons who devoured the Artemis series. I have been waiting for this movie to bring those amazing characters to life since 2007, when I first cracked the cover of Artemis Fowl. I read them all aloud to my kids and as they grew, we've all revisited them. Compelling, funny, work with characters and dialogue that snap off the page.I'm an avid movie-goer who has loved Kenneth Branaugh's directing work since he took on Shakespeare in the 90s. He made the bard so accessible for millions of viewers. He's been knighted fergawdssake.Josh Gad is normally so amazingly funny and fun to watch. Judy Dench is an international treasure. WTAF is up with their voices. In a "heart wrenching" scene, Diggums grumbles,"Listen to the two of us, grunting at each other like a pair of hippos with a throat infection". I clapped because that's how they both sound THE. WHOLE. MOVIE.So you start with amazing source material, give it a monstrous budget, leave it in the hands of a skilled director with shining stars and WHAT HAPPENED, DISNEY?Colfer has to be hurling. If he were dead, he'd be spinning in his grave like a powerdrill.I am the first to understand that sometimes license must be taken to establish tricky plot points. I will suspend disbelief if there is a payoff that is similar to the source material. The producers of this movie, however, put the source material in a blender, pureed it, ran it through test audiences and came up with the most unwatchable pablum I've seen on the screen.Let's spoil it up:Do you ove the Angeline redemption line, whereby Artemis' mother, so distraught that her best true love is missing and presumed dead at the hands of the Russian Mafia that she walks like a ghost in her room when she can bring herself to get out of bed?Can it. She's dead. (which would be a really tricky thing to explain when his twin brothers Becket and Myles come into play in book 6).Do you love the erudite, sharply dressed and exercise-eschewing criminal mastermind that Artemis has become as he singlehandedly carries on the family crime business and painstakingly researches fairies on his own, deciding he will catch one?Forgetaboutit. He's a surfer now, in jeans, tees and sweatshirts. He only dons a suit for the battle and they begin with him IN SCHOOL. It's a big point in the books that he's wiggled his way out of school with his genius. And Dad's in the picture from the start, force feeding him fairy lore. They crack the gnommish language completely without the fairyButler as a one-man wrecking crew (the third best martial artist in the world) who won't reveal his first name?Sooooorry. He's introduced as "Dom or Domovoi" by Diggums right off the bat. He's seen training martial arts only once and only kicks butt with the aid of Holly's fairy weapon.Teenaged Juliet has been inexplicably reduced to a 12-year old. I assume this is because they thought this would be a series so she could grow into the role?Diggums is now full human sized, wishing only to be a normal sized dwarf.While I loved Foaly's hair as it recalled a horse's mane, all of his snark was written out of the picture and his CGI centaur-ness didn't work visually.Opal Koboi is introduced right off the bat where she didn't appear until book 2 in the series. You never actually see anything but a cloakedHolly as a driven elf trying to prove herself capable to the demanding Commander Root as the one and only female in LEP Recon?Naw, she just wants to clear her dad's name. (Aaaand, there's no dad in any of the books for Holly - total crap) She's not at the Oak tree to perform the sacred ritual to restore her magic, but rather goes there to find her dad's badge? She has no edge.Did you find the restoring ritual interesting and cool?Hold it in your hearts, viewer because it's completely written off here.Did you like Julius Root as a curmudgeonly foil?I have no problem with casting Root as a female - but the essential anger is gone. In the books, he's called "beetroot" by the troops because of this epic anger. The only anger here is the audience's at having to watch this hatchet job.************The premise decimated, the 90 minutes reels out an overly expository, nonsensical flattening of the source material with zero stakes, zero chemistry, zero character development and zero heart.I so wish I could give this zero stars. Today it's at 9% on Rotten Tomatoes. I think that's a very generous mark.Pure, unadulterated junk.

reviews.review_title: Not only a terrible adaptation, but a wholly incompetently-made film on every level
reviews.content: I was extremely impressed by this movie. What impressed me was just how terribly and thoroughly they managed to botch this movie. Instead of trying to figure out what people liked about the books, it felt as though they took a bunch of random pages from the books and completely reinvented the characters to fit some random scriblings. A lot of the names are there, but the characters are off, especially Artemis. The movie version of him isn't even a pale facsimile of the book version.Now, it is entirely possible to adapt a book and completely change everything about it and still stay true to the spirit of the books or to at least make a good movie even if it's nothing like the books. However, this movie fails just as a movie. It is an absolute mess. It felt as though they took a 4 hour movie and randomly removed 2.5 hours from it. We go from Holly wanting to do terrible things to Artemis to being best buddies with him in like 5 minutes for no reason at all. Character development and motivations are just tossed. There is no coherent flow to this movie.On top of that, we get this really terrible narration by Josh Gad doing his best Batman impersonation (Judi Dench does hers as well). The problem with the narration is that it is extremely transparent that it's there to tell us what is going on and why and who these characters are because otherwise we'd have no idea that Butler is supposed to be a big badass (never shown in the movie) or that Artemis is this criminal mastermind/genius (not really shown in the movie either - Artemis is significantly more of a passive participant than he is in the books where he's a driving force of action) or any of a bunch of other things that could have been relayed to us in a more interesting way. I also can't help but think that maybe they thought the target audience was filled with morons and needed things spoon-fed to us.As a family, we listened to these books while driving to and from Glacier National Park a couple years ago. My son, who is 12, was so excited for this movie. It was a major reason why we signed up for Disney+. I knew beforehand that this movie had significant issues, so I tried to gently tamp down expectations. He said he enjoyed the movie, but I have no doubt that he was both disappointed and confused as to why this movie only superficially bears any resemblance to the books.It is stunning to me that they managed to make such an incompetent movie, especially when you had someone experienced like Kenneth Branagh at the helm. A truly missed opportunity as this could have been a great movie series. Hopefully it gets rebooted in a few years, maybe as a TV show.

I pray the next Film in the series Only becomes better than the previous. Thank you Disney for staying true for all of our imaginations.

reviews.review_title: It is lynched in vain...a typical post-2008 movie "Kenneth Branagh".
reviews.content: First slated for August 2019, the adaptation of Eoin Colfer's young adult novel series "Artemis Foul" seemed bound for trouble when it was delayed into 2020. Then pushed again. Then COVID-19 hit and all bets were off. Making matters worse, the trailers for the Kenneth Branagh-directed adaptation seemed to hint that the series was in for a set of changes likely to upset fans of the eight-book series. It wasn't the hiring of Judi Dench as the originally male-written Commander Root or the race-changing of Domovoi Butler, both cosmetic changes at best, but the adjustment of the cold, sociopathic Artemis Fowl II, around whom the series is centered, to appearing more light-hearted and heroic. Fans, take comfort in knowing that while this may not be the exact representation you know, there's little doubt that Artemis is a different sort of villain to root for.
