reviews.review_title: An insult to source material and fans
reviews.content:
The announcement of an Artemis Fowl adaptation thrilled us. The series was bedtime reading for my daughter for years. She's re-read them on her own repeatedly. Kenneth Brannagh has crapped all over them and left us with something less appealing than the effluvia from Mulch Diggums's bum-flap.
Storyline? Abandoned and replaced with generic mcguffin hunt. Setups for future stories are ignored making it impossible to progress as Colfer planned and doing a Rian Johnson on any future directors should this persistent floater somehow manage to garner a sequel.
Characters? Changed on fundamental levels, undermined and devalued in every way. Character arcs and development are abandoned. Relationships are fundamentally altered and one character, vital to later stories is dead offscreen before this even gets going. Juliet, who didn't appear in the first book, is stuck in but then used to do nothing but offer other characters food rather than being the badass she would be and is introduced as.
World building? Inept and confused (Just why would the fairies have a table that's too big for them?) Fails to explain vital points for the uninitiated, wastes too much time badly explaining stuff that shouldn't even be there.
Script? Clumsy, stumbling inanely from cliche to cliche. Underestimating the audience's intelligence at every moment and where clunky exposition wasn't forced into a character's mouth it's slapped on in an awkward, out-of character narration.
Virtue signalling? There in spades but actually undermining the way the books challenge equality issues and the diversity it actually includes. Holly is supposed to be brown, so she's whitewashed. The Butlers -strangely no longer brother and sister - are meant to be Oriental (yes, I know Americans don't like that word but Asian means something different here and would mask the point I'm trying to make). Both of them fail dismally to do their jobs within the story or to represent the characters in the books. Holly is meant to be the first female officer in L.E.P.- Recon that's abandoned. Artemis' outsider status is given a moment's lip-service between showing him as a cool, active jock rather than relying solely on his intelligence and using assets like Butler to compensate for his shortcomings. Here, he has none.
There isn't one single redeeming feature in this, unless it's that Holly's uniform fits with how we always imagined it.

reviews.review_title: How to ruin a great book series in just six easy steps!
reviews.content: 1. Find a very beloved and popular YA novel that is at least a decade old, and by extension very outdated. Make sure not to update anything whatsoever from the original book.2. Suck out all of the personality traits of the original characters from the book, and replace them with nothing.3. Make the most obnoxious character from the book series the movie's narrator, in addition to giving him a lot of extra screen time.4. Purposely change aspects of the book's story to now make zero sense, in addition to adding in plot elements that are equally nonsensical.5. Make sure that all of the actors involved give the worst performances of their careers and/or do an atrocious Irish accent, even if they live in the center of the Earth and not anywhere near Ireland.6. Give the film a budget that's over $120 million, but make the special effects look like they're from the early 90s.And... congratulations, you've done it! Now watch as your film gets absolutely ravaged by everyone and gets added to the giant pile of failed YA book-to-film adaptations."Disaster" is too kind a word for this film. It takes everything great about the books and either weakens them or gets rid of them entirely. And for newcomers to the series, it will be incredibly confusing, generic, and convoluted. Avoid this movie at all costs.Final Score: 15/100.

This movie deserves 0 stars. It's not Artemis Fowl and it can't even get by on its own merits as a movie. The story has been completely changed from the books it's supposedly based on to the point where it's completely unrecognizable as Artemis Fowl in any sense. The characters have been completely changed as well. Artemis is meant to be 12-year-old criminal mastermind with the disposition of a Vulcan that was well aware of his family's criminal enterprises for his entire life and brought up to eventually take over for his father and keep their criminal empire running. He detested athletic activity and was always extremely formal, constantly wearing suits even in his down time. His father went missing when he was very young, held by the Russian mafia, and it drove his mother insane. He was left to keep everything going and at 12 he kidnapped a fairy and ransomed her for gold. Though the protagonist, in the first book Artemis was very much the villain.In this movie Artemis is clearly just a kid that is smarter than everybody else. They kept his "kid genius" trait and removed everything else. His first appearance in the film is him surfing, something the true Artemis would never have done. He's constantly seen in typical clothing you would expect a kid to wear during the first portion of the film rather than his signature suits. His mother is dead and his father is kidnapped by Opal Koboi, the reoccurring villain that was introduced in the second book and had nothing to do with the Fowl family until Artemis II foiled her schemes. Movie Artemis has an emotional outburst when he learned from a news broadcast that his father is suspected of being a criminal and denies the accusations, eventually having to be dragged away by Butler, who in the movie prefers his first name despite it being a major part of his character in the books that his first name is to remain a secret unless he's dying. Butler is the one that introduces Artemis to the reality of faeries, which is what his dad was involved in, rather than Artemis discovering faeries and dragging Butler and Juliet into it with him like in the books.All of the characters have been drastically changed in similar manners, their traits and backstories completely thrown out the window and rewritten. They're mere caricatures of the characters they're supposed to be.Even forgetting that this was supposed to be a book adaptation the movie wasn't very good. The acting is bland and the actors are always either trying too hard or not trying hard enough. The manor is beautiful from the outside but there's far too big a disconnect between the style of the exterior and the style of the interior. The voice over narration by Josh is terrible, far too raspy and often difficult to understand due to that fact. The plot of the movie is very basic and recycled from nearly every hero or spy B movie ever made. The characters are watered down stereotypes with no depth to them at all. All in all, it's just terrible. Disney wasted so much money on a movie that turned out to be complete garbage.If you're thinking about watching "Artemis Fowl" my advice would be to just watch Spy Kids or Men in Black again instead. It's basically those two movies combined in the worst ways possible and somehow both of those movies are better films than this one.

This is an embarrassment on so many fronts, but I'll concentrate on the sloppy storytelling and script writing. Josh Gad either tells us stuff they forgot to film (or was too expensive to film) or exposition that the movie-makers elected not to bother revealing through dialogue.Speaking dialogue, nearly every line by every character is pure exposition, like a police procedural on TV. There is no character development; hence, there are no characters arcs. Artimus Jr. is a mostly unlikable kid who is so smart has has an answer to everything. He's written so paper-thin he's almost less than one-dimensional. And it doesn't help that the actor portraying him slips in and out of his accent, and delivers his lines very flat.The only thing marginally good about the film is the music, and even that gets repetitive. This may be worse than A Wrinkle in Time, but it's close. It's hard to believe that someone didn't see this train wreck coming prior to going into production.

reviews.review_title: Why was this not a series?
reviews.content: So much stuff is crammed in 1.36 hours. Characters start to call each other and care for each other without having a proper introduction with each other, let alone with the audience. Judy Dench was fine but her voice was annoyingly garvely for some reason. The only one I really had problems with was the kid playing Artemis as his performance was terrible.Overall not recommended. Maybe it is fun if you imagine every 10 minutes of the movie is a full episode of a series and you imagine the parts with character development. This movie had potention and it was filmed quite nicely, but it completely missed the goal it was going for.

I just watched a film that failed on every single level.... was there even a story here... it was basically all a first act.. no development.. no mystery, nothing at all.... a mother that was taken before her time... ahh here could be something.. but no just nothing... dismal.

How does a company like Disney make such a big mistake? This movie abandoned everything that we knew and loved about the story. The direction was awful and the story was a jumble of so many books that it felt like they wanted to make the the movie just because they had nothing to make. The movie was a letdown from what we saw in the trailer.

reviews.review_title: A nice tale about fairies and human
reviews.content: First and foremost, the special effects were awesome. The story is about a son who is seeking his abducted father. Soon he realizes that his father was collaborating with the fairy's community. The story is a fairy tale. The movie is well made by Disney. To me, the ending could be improved. I saw nice acting especially from Colin Farrell and Josh Gad. I think this was only 1% of Colin's acting capabilities. I saw some good acting from him in The Lobster 2015 (?). I liked the special effects especially the parts that were showing the fairy's colony. In general, I enjoyed watching this movie and I was amazed by the special effects. In summary, I recommend watching this movie to fairy tale style movie fans.

OK, you don't have to read the books to watch the movie, but millions have. The ENTIRE concept of the Artemis Fowl character is that he is a criminal genius with a MISSING father and a mentally unstable mother. Those are the facts that drive the character in the book. Those are also the facts that the movie completely changed. It's like if you made a movie from the first Harry Potter book, eliminated magic, set it in New York and made Ron the evil character. If might be a good movie but it WOULD NOT be Harry Potter any more. The Artemis Fowl books are wonderful and yes, there is creative licence when going from the written art form to the film art form, but completely altering the primary essence of the characters and the situation was absolutely criminal.

reviews.review_title: First hour was fantastic, then the writer/s gave up...
reviews.content: Let me start off by saying I absolutely loved the beginning of this movie it was great, and had the makings of a classic, then after and hour they gave up and it became the laziest written quickest ending to a movie (if you can even call it an ending) I have ever watched. Put the extra 45 minutes into the movie where you actually have a fight with the villain and they go get the dad, not just have him magically beam home, to set up a 15 min cliff hanger. And poor Tamara Smart, what a waste of a potentially great character, give her something to do, her role was pointless, with so much potential. Honestly I hope Disney does a sequel and quick to build on what could have been really good, but ended up really lame.

This is a truly bad film. The plot is illogical, more a series of loosely connected events, with no real structure or purpose.The cast is largely inexperienced, and put in lacklustre performances. There are exceptions, but are either not long on screen (Colin Farrell) or miscast (Judy Dench). In the end it failed to hold my attention beyond the first 15 minutes, and I only finished it out of a sense of completeness.For fans of the books, it is even worse. Artemis has been changed out of all recognition, from a cerebral genius to a bland action hero. Rather than discover the fairy world, it was handed to him on a plate by his father.His mother is dead.Butler has been neutered, (including using his first name), Juliet has been turned into a 12 year old girl and hence made useless, and Holly goes from prisoner to partner in 10 minutes rather than several books. Turning Mulch into a 'Giant dwarf' is another awful change.Overall this is a waste of time and money. I only rated it as high as a 3 because I watched it all

Just... Wow. This is one of those films that really gets you scratching your head. How on earth did it get made? What happened? Surely everyone behind the scenes must be cursing whomever or whatever got them involved. I've never read the books, so I have no opinion on it as an adaptation, only as a children's film in its own right, but this is a car crash of epic proportions, given its apparent budget of around $125m.There's so much talent behind this, that it leaves you utterly perplexed as to how it could turn out so badly. I can only imagine that at some point the production became such a tangled mess, that all of the talented people behind the camera threw up their arms in defeat, gave up, and decided to film just enough footage to throw together a semblance of something to please the producers.There's no point going into the story, because it's all such an incoherent mess that there's no point. It even requires a character to regularly narrate most events, simply so that there's a vague hint of why random things are happening (And the reason for that character's narration is itself flimsy).Most of the actors are perfectly serviceable, given the material, except the lead, Ferdia Shaw. I hate to say anything bad about a child actor, so perhaps this is all Kenneth Branagh's fault, giving an inexperienced actor so little direction and such a terrible script. As the title character, Ferdia unfortunately comes over as lifeless and wooden. To an extent, you can blame the story and script. The few scenes where he could have shown a hint of emotion are so badly pieced together that there was no real potential to do anything, and the story is so devoid of anything to make us like or care about his character that it would have made little difference if there was. In fact, he hasn't really _got_ a character, he just delivers lines from time-to-time.As for Dame Judy Dench... Oh my, she should have known better. She totally embarrasses herself in this mess, with a costume that makes her look foolish and a silly accent/voice that induces head-shaking despair.Moving on from the actors, the script itself is terrible at best. The child actors have to deliver lines that are not only unnatural, but are the worst forms of "We're telling the viewer something directly! This is very important because... we say it's important!"Visually the film has the usual pretty sheen that you would expect from a big-budget Hollywood production, which is all the more tragic given the material it's utilised for.So why two stars? Well, it's never boring. So much is thrown at the screen, along with a relatively short runtime, along with so many moments of "What the hell is going on? Why did they do that? That line was awful! Oh, Judy, why!? " that it's near impossible to reach true boredom.Beyond that, this is one of the worst big-budget Hollywood movies I've seen, and I've seen The Last Jedi... But at least there's some colourful visuals that young kids might enjoy for an hour and a half.
The story is just boring.. Expected so much more from the trailer!

Wow!!! This is like a CGI vomit ride of disorienting visual garbage! I thought Michael Bay's TRANSFORMERS franchise was a visual onslaught of confounding visual effects that cause spastic convulsions but Artemis Fowl combines that with an unfollowablecdisconnected schizophrenic mess of characters that one doesn't even have time nor care to remember... including the lead character... what's his name again? Wow! Just Wow! Where is Oprah on psychedelics when I wed her?!?!?

I actually enjoyed this movie with my kids ... I have not read the books maybe that's why but if you go into it just wanting to watch a decent movie give it a go ! I wouldn't mind a number 2 but with all the bad reviews I doubt it'll happen.

Although it is different from the books, it includes the important parts of some of the books to create a thrilling movie for the family to watch. The kids loved it and were on the edge of their seats the whole time. It brings magic and fairies to life in an exciting and adventurous way. Lara McDonnell's performance as Holly Short showed her natural talent and made the whole idea of fairies seem real. Excited to see if they make a second film as I know the kids will love it.
Confusing, bad special effects and poor plot. This is not the Disney I would expect. They could do way better.

reviews.review_title: Why name it Artemis Fowl at all?
reviews.content: It's nothing like the books. If you're going to invoke the lame "creative inspiration" excuse, then you might as well make an entirely original movie. Why use the same names when it otherwise has zero association with the book series? Lame cash grab by Disney, lame story (my attention flagged midway through, of not earlier), lame characters that are nothing like the book & even lame CGI usage. Blah!

This movie totally ruin and destroy the novel. The story from the novel describes AF as genious and criminal kid and a survivor but this movie tell story which totally different.
Where the idea about this movie making this AF only want to become hero wannabe to save his father?
I have no idea why the writter allowing the script writter making this horrible story. It's better not using Artemis Fowl book adaptation but making a new different movie.

reviews.review_title: A mix of non-sense visual effects with no story.
reviews.content:
It's a poor story with some forced visual effects that make no sense. The Artemis fowl has really no powers. Holly should be the main character. The father has no importance. The big dwarf is just silly. The giant has not really strong powers.
It gives a hint of a Artemis fowl 2 which I would really be disappointed to watch if is the same kind of movie.Boring to the point I was seeing all the time left

reviews.review_title: Good potential. The family enjoyed it.
reviews.content: The story line is good. As an adult there are flaws, however all of my 6 children enjoyed the movie. They could have embellished and drew out the story line a little better but we still enjoyed it as a family. (Ages 10-16 children)

Let me say as an Artemis Fowl fan that has read all the books has been waiting more than 20 years to see this movie I was absolutely Amazed by it the only thing I will say against it is that I didn't like that they made the character of Commander root a female when in the books he was a male other than that I found it to be spot on accepting of course that they did not have Artemis going to Haven City when they did in the book other than that this is an amazing family film and I would certainly recommend it to any children 13 years or older do do some suggestive themes and Mild violence this is definitely definitely a film I would recommend anybody go and see young or old well worth the time and effort though you have to have access to disney plus i personally cant wait for the second film
I thought that if they had to do a female for Julius route that Judi Dench was the perfect person for the role this is well worth it
Is an "incredible" movie it has everything and the actors are great

I havent read the books, so not outraged they werent reflected word for word. The film overall was an ok afternoon movie. Didnt really go anywhere and not much happened (they only leave the house in the last 10 minutes). Cast were fine for the most parts, main failing was Artemis, kid just couldnt act and had no personality to drive it along. If you havent read the books and kids want a movie for 90 minutes then it is worth a view. Just dont get your hopes up for much, doubt the sequel they was setting up will ever happen.

I liked it! I haven't read the books, so I can't do a comparison, but it was fun to watch. I really couldn't get that attached though, because there was pretty much NO character development, but come on... a 1? Save that for the really bad ones!

It truly breaks my heart to see how badly Eoin Colfer's wonderful story has been so badly written! The writers turned Artemis into a sob story of a character instead of the emotional hard, Sherlock Holmes level genius, he is in the very first book. Completely straying from the story has caused the whole movie to be not even a tolerable B movie. This series could have easily rivaled the Harry Potter franchise, but with this horrendously botched effort it looks like this will run it into the ground. The removal of his mother, one of his main concerns, is disheartening and the instant retrieval of his father appallingly boring! Adding to this the introduction of many characters that are never mentioned in the first book obliterating all mystery and forging the strong, highly trained Butler to a whimpering side show. If you have read the books please don't watch this movie it will break your heart as it did mine to see a character from my childhood eviscerated!

The main character is not believable and the story is kind of week.
It has it moments, i loved the gigantic dwarf (now he was believable)!

reviews.review_title: The Last Airbender all over again
reviews.content: This movie felt like I was watching an exceptionally long trailer for the movie. From the choppy music to the porely edited scenes it just felt like they took the entire movie, cut out allot & just kept what would fit into their wanted time frame. Very disappointing just glad theaters are closed & I didn't have to pay for this.

A parent somewhere will rent this movie as a gift to their child who has been reading the books. Little do they know of the imaginative scouring that child's mind is about to receive. There were some thoughts at the time of The Two Towers movie that, despite how well Gollum was depicted on screen, there can be something said for the lost opportunity to imagine that creature for oneself. In that case I accepted it, but movies such as these squander the opportunity for minds to embellish the written fiction in a way that is meaningful to them. I would avoid letting the image of, say, Mulch and his horrifying CGI jaw taking hold as a credible depiction of the character, and for this I can only discount the movie as merely a cynical name-recognition money maker for Disney that is its own mangled Frankenstein creation quite separate from Artemis Fowl actual. 1 star.
There is nothing to say that hasn't been said, it's garbage that uses the Artemis Fowl name hope the author got some cash for it.

I can't believe some of the reviews about this film. People are getting so critical and not just sitting back and enjoying the ride. Someone said it's the worst film they have ever seen. They can't have watched many films. What's not to like about this film. The effects are stunning. The whole fairy world was beautiful. Mulch Diggums dialogue was really funny. Josh Gad is great. Our beloved Dame Judy Dench is a Leprechaun. It has Colin Farrell in it. Need I say more. There could have been more character development but it was cut quite a lot. I think if you haven't seen it watch it on a Saturday morning with some chocolate.
Just when I thought the movie was starting and there was going to be a quest or adventure, the movie ended. So much potential, extremely poorly written.

reviews.review_title: Top 3 worst movies I've ever had the misfortune of watching
reviews.content:
Even if you haven't read the books, and consider this film completely stand alone, this is by far one of the worst movies ever made. Kenneth Branagh has no idea what he's doing and his justifications for some of the choices he took made me question his sanity.
The dialogue is cringy, and incredibly disjointed. It's as if all the actors were in seperate rooms while delivering their lines and they just edited it all together.
Casting of actors: horrible.
Special effects: horrible
Story line: horrible
Editing: horrible
Directing: horrible.
Experience: The worst

reviews.review_title: Not read the books as a film it's great
reviews.content: We as a family have not read the books, and I know we will read them... And yes, I know the books are always better - films always change characters, to fit the market. This a film was interesting. Josh Gads narration is annoying tbh, love the fact that Dame Judi is it and Colin Farrel! The reason why the direction of the film is SO squiffy if you read the trivia Harvey Weinstein was the original director and then it got taken over by Kenneth Branagh! So quit your moaning enjoy a family film and continue to read the books! #ArtemisFowl

Come on Disney. They aren't even trying at this point. It's a shameless cash grab that shouldn't even exist. I have read the original novel and this takes that novel and tarnishes it. I don't mind movies taking their source material and changing it. The Shining is one of my favorite films of all time and it changes the original book but they made a story that was interesting. This movie changed the story into the most bland, unoriginal, and boring story of the year. It's kind of insulting to the original novel. None of the performances are good. Judi Dench and Josh Gad feel so out of place here and Colin Farrell does absolutely nothing. The dialogue is cringy and the action is dull. The shots are uninteresting and the sequence of events is repetitive and boring. I thought nothing would be worse than Dolittle but here we are. At least Dolittle was somewhat entertaining in how bad it was but this is so much worse.

Quite possible one of the worst films I have ever seen. After 20 minutes I had to consult the Wikipedia plot description to try and figure out what was happening on screen and I still couldn't follow the nonsensical plot.

reviews.review_title: Lockdown in the country with nothing new being released and still it was hard to watch this
reviews.content: Overacting or no acting skills was the motto of the movie. There was no tension or excitement in the movie. The tone was absolutely bland. The lead character, the boy is unlikable, as an actor but mostly as the character. He is shown to be an arrogant and conceited little brat who knows everything and is super intelligent but doesn't have respect for anybody. He walks like a goofball which shows that he isn't what the director wants to portray. In reality he is a geek who cannot act for his life. Yet somehow we are supposed to like him. His character didn't prove himself to be that genius as he did nothing special to prove his worth. The most annoying part was the continuous narration of the movie. Omg why wouldn't they stop it! Just keeps ruining the flow of the movie. And what is with the super hoarse voice of the narrator and the fairy villain. It was really irritating to hear those completely made up voices. If this is the last movie left to watch, you can watch it because at least there is a fairy world with good production value added to the special effects.

If you've read the books, this destroys all of the basic plot points of the series, just don't bother.
If you haven't read them then welcome to the most politically correct film in history,it ticks every diversity box in history at the detriment of story and ability. It is also drivel so just don't bother

This is terrible. Poor acting and dreadful dialogue, the opposite from what you'd expect from Branagh at the helm. Colin Farrell the only decent performance in the first 20 minutes and that's all that I could stomach of this.No wonder Disney changed there mind about a cinema release for this.

reviews.review_title: You had one job: follow any one of the books...
reviews.content: ...instead they made an utterly horrible, flashy, impossible to make sense of story, and took away the core essence of Artemis himself. The whole point of Artemis was that he was the only one who figured out the existence of fairies alone.Plus skipping the scene of Butler smashing the troll in full armour is a crime and someone should be fired. (I'm not joking.)Don't watch this film.

reviews.review_title: Why must you change everything? You ruined it.
reviews.content:
Congrats hollywood, you've done it again.
Take a successful book with beloved characters and change everything... because you know better.
You've changed key characteristics of the central characters, changed their motivation and turned the stories into cliched slop.
The grizzled, old time field agent Commander Pool is recast as... Judy Dench?
The enormous, muscular, unstoppable force that is Butler is recast as... a fat faced fat man.
Artemis himself, well you've just changed his fundamental nature.
This is as bad an adaptation from book to film as i have seen.
So congrats hollywood, you've ruined yet another readymade franchise with your self satisfied arrogance. Stupid, stupid, stupid.
What the actual F. Did the movie creators even read the book? Completely ruined great story from childhood.

reviews.review_title: what a dumpster fire of a movie!
reviews.content: I would give this movie a 0/10 if it was a thing! It's an incoherent mess beginning to end. If you're a fan of the books, brace yourself... you're in for a real disappointment...all the changes are cringe worthy... and the story makes no sense. I can't believe Disney made this garbage.

Not only is this a complete insult to the books but also a complete disaster of a film. Literally nothing in this movie works. The humor is cringey, the acting is bad and the story from the books has been completely butchered. This is definitely top 5 worst adaptations of any book series. It's probably up there as one of the worst movies I've seen!!!!

reviews.review_title: Didn't read the book. Didn't like the movie
reviews.content: I know nothing about the book series. I didn't even know what it's about. So I watched this with a totally fresh mind. And... everything is wrong with the movie.Useless explosition plot deviceUnlikable charactersBoring plotMcGuffinObviously, this franchise has already joined Eragon, Narnia and Percy Jackson. Adaptations that died very quickly. Well done, Disney...

reviews.review_title: Who did the casting and screenplay?
reviews.content: Whoever did the cast of child lead actor have no idea in acting the lead was horrible and screenplay so bad need to take headaches medicine

reviews.review_title: Boring and waste of time! Worst Disney movie of this 21st century so far!
reviews.content: I have not read the Artemis fowl books but this was so confusing and boring. It was just a waste of time. This is the worst Disney movie in the last 20 years. Doesn't deserve to have the Disney Logo.. I CAN'Y BELIEVE THAT DISNEY MADE THIS!!. And the special effects are so yucky! Ugh! In fact, it was so boring that I stopped watching it in the middle and finished it the next day. Such a shame for Disney, and that too from the director of 'Cinderella' which was a great movie!

I have no context of the books or what the this story should be,I am reviewing based on the movie only.
It is horrible. While the visuals are good,the acting is bad.The story is fragmented,confusing and disjointed. There is no heart in this story. Yet for me the worse part about this movie is the 'hero ' himself.Artemis is an obnoxious know-it-all who lacks any humor or charm.Maybe the books paint him as an elite brat who thinks his intellect awards him the ability to be 'Fowl' to others, but it is not an admirable quality. The acting by the young Artemis is also quite bland and void of any real emotions.
Dame Judy should not be in this movie...this mess should not be on her record and Colin did well to hide himself for most of this film.
It was a waste of time and energy. I read the reviews and felt curious after hearing how bad they all were.The reality is true...it should be renamed to Atrocious Fowl.

I read the books as a child and reread them two years ago when I found out there would eventually be a movie. But this is an affront! It feels like someone put the first two books in a blender and then picked out the biggest parts and merged them together, leaving out so many important details and links, the real magic gets lost and the characters are just so off I am not interested in following anyone.
This is a blatant (not even) mediocre hollywood production looking like it's been made in the 90s with a really low budget (though some designs look quite nice but that's not enough to watch this movie). Kenneth Branagh assaults (once more) the original piece of art and makes it absolutely preposterous.
This movie cost 125 million for goodness sake! This could have been such a great movie .... and now I just want to cry.

reviews.review_title: Have never touched Artemis fowl but I feel bad for y'all
reviews.content: I know how you all feel, I've experienced with the maze runner so imma help you out and give it a 1 star.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyed this one. Standard Disney fair
reviews.content: Yeah yeah sorry it isn't a faithful representation of the book. For someone like me who hasn't read the books as I am far too old the move was just fine. Done judge a movie by its book.
Judi Dench sounds just like Ian Paisley in this movie. What could be more Disney Eh? Just waiting for her to say Never, Never, Never!!! The fairies say No! Disgusting.
Shaw was excellent in this...a credit to the clan. Gad, Anozie, Dench, and McDonnell put out wonderfully enjoyable performances. I want to read the books when libraries re-open.
Not read the book but I loved this movie adaptation. Not quite sure why so many hated it. It seems with such negative reviews I doubt there will be a sequel?

I'm an adult. I read the books as a adult. I saw the trailer and was confused. I've seen the movie now and I'm POed. What was this supposed to be? The whole thing didn't make much sense. It was lame. It was terrible. It basically killed Artemis' genius and replaced it with some drivel. I want my 95 minutes back. Don't watch it. Your time would be better spent cataloguing your navel lint.

We saw this coming a long time ago. It is clear that, disney is borrowing just the lore from the books, but not adapting it. It had a great potential for becoming great, with a lot of good source material and a very huge following for the books. but, this looks and feels like a disney TV movie. I don't know what all went into play, but this one should have never been a childish movie. It could have been made in to a much pretentiously dark and goosebump ride.
OK, lets forget the source material and talk just about the film.
The generic soundtrack is totally forgettable, there is no artemis fowl theme that excite us. All that we think is that at least 'A Wrinkle In Time' had a good-ish soundtrack.
The script is too shallow. When it's trying to surprise us, It announces "hey we're going to surprise you", this keeps happening again and again.
The fact that Artemis is a genius is not shown but spoken throughout repeatedly.
Even the cinematography is muddled and fails to keep us in focus.
And when the dust settles, our hero walk to the camera in slow motion out of nowhere to sell us that he has evolved into a genius criminal mastermind, and how do we know that, because he spells it out for us.
Branagh uses all the slo-mos and cgi to sell us the next harry potter franchise, but with no heart, just poor lazy effort.
But I'm sure even Branagh let out a sigh after watching the end product because this one is dead on arrival.
Remember how harry potter books became a staple for children after the movies, this is going to do the opposite because,
1, This will be forgotten by next week because there are better memes than this to spent time on,
2, I, an avid fan of the original books can't even begin to think about reading a book about this mess.
And the fans who were hoping for this can just ignore this movie's presence and get on with your hopes again. Because this is not it, Not even close.

I watched this last night and while it wasn't great, it wasn't horrible. I had read the book when it first came out so hadn't remembered much of it, so wasn't doing any comparisons. The acting for sure wasn't top shelf, but passable.

reviews.review_title: (1.0/10) The worst film I have ever seen.
reviews.content: Words can't describe how awful this movie is. You truly have to watch it yourself to see exactly how this movie fails to tell it's story well and how the characters are as expressive as a damp piece of cardboard. Avoid this movie at all costs. There are better uses of your time.

reviews.review_title: Skip the Movie, Read the Book Series Instead
reviews.content: Disney changed everything that make this book interesting.First is the casting, The child actor who play the title role is not arrogant enough he more came of as a smart kid similar to the little boy in The Umbrella Academy instead criminal mind little monster. Artemis I pictured as Tom Felton's Malfoy in Harry Potter and like Robbie Kay (Peter Pan in Once Upon a Time type). The actor who play Butler is miscast; Butler was a big man like Dwayne Johnson not bulky. They made Holly Short and Juliet around Artemis age group. In the book, Holly was an adult and Juliet was teenage and she was Butler's sister, not his niece. They made the father know about the fairies exist and kidnap by Opal, but was kidnap by Russian mafia. Sadly they wasted good talents like Colin Farrell and poor Judi Dench in this disappointing adaption, This movie joins with A Wrinkle in Time as a bad film. I agreed to previous reviews why it went straight to streaming not to theater.For those who never read Artemis Fowl, please to read it and understand the story better than this.

reviews.review_title: Far better than reviews make out!
reviews.content:
Lets start with the big 4,
Farrell is playing a minor role, the set up. He is not wasted! He just isn't the lead!
Dame Judy, she is fabulous, again, not wasted. I think she has just reach a point in her career where she is more concerned with having fun with a wider diversification of characters. And why not. Love her as the grizzled old fairy military leader!
Gads, Gads has taken more than a few oddball roles, for no other reason that he had the time and like the idea, just look at that randon aussie zombie flick he did. He did kinda steal the show, but it also felt like it was all a pilot like set up for future movies or a tv series.
Branagh, I think he did a good job visually and the story unrolls nicely. But possibly aimed for the wrong age group. The dry humour seems to have gone over the heads of the american critics based on their reviews and would not be something young fans of the books would necessarily get.
This movie was a fun. But while I doubt current fans of the books will be satisified, the mythicly and visually interesting introduction to the world of Artemis Fowl is wonderful. If you haven't read the books, this will make you want to! It could easily be a jumping off point for a tv series focussed on the 3 kids while the other adult characters are elsewhere, but if required could do the occasiinal cameo.

Kenneth Branagh; Why on earth would you adapt a book into a movie, if you're going to completely ignore the book? It's popular for a reason; and if you feel the need to change everything that makes that book and its' characters what they are; then this simply wasn't the project for you to begin with.You'd think that for a story about a magical world you'd get some type of pretty, epic adventure. Somehow they made this movie feel so ridiculously 'small', as about 80% of the movie literally just takes place in the same house.This movie honestly makes me worried about the new Percy Jackson series that's coming to Disney+. You'd think they'd know how to do a proper adaptation in 2020. Shame.
We need more of these movies I liked it there should be a part two

Although this doesn't strictly follow the book, my kids loved it, especially the fairy girl Holly. It's hard to find a movie the whole family can watch and this was it. I don't understand some of the negative reviews. This was a great family movie that we all enjoyed!

reviews.review_title: This film is an insult to the fans!
reviews.content:
Ah where do I even begin...Artemis Fowl is a film based on a series of a popular novel. But you see, Disney took away every cool and interesting elements from the book and turned it to a film that doesn't even interest the kids. what we miss in this motion picture you ask?
A wicked criminal mastermind who happened to be a kid (how cool is that?), Genius plans or missions, Exciting actions, Sense of humor (the book was hilarious), cool sci-fi tech (I saw some toys in the film though!), Characterization, Casting (yes director literally ask his gangs from other movies to play the role... how professional), Mediocre designs and directing and the most important part... the main story (with elements of surprise). Companies really need to be more careful with these popular titles. As a book fan not only I did not like the movie, I actually HATED it! We are angry! This motion picture insults each and every fan of the novels. We all know turning a book to a movie is difficult and challenging, But if you can not keep it close enough don't do it.
Bottom Lines:
-I feel sorry for Eoin Colfer (author) for giving up on this project. you should have not agreed your masterpiece to be a movie in the first place. Ask Netflix they know what to do!
Anime Companies could do a hell of a job for crying out loud!

There doesn't seem to be any actual story here, at least one that makes sense. It's called Artemis Fowl but he's not really in that much of it and doesn't really seem to do anything when he is except stand around staring or delivering dry dialogue. I guess they're a family of thieves or something? His dad gets kidnapped by some angry guy in a hood, nothing really happens there. Then there's some fight at the Fowl mansion for some reason that didn't seem well explained, then some fairy chick disappears into an egg thing. reviews.review_title: Has This Direct Streaming Flick Fowled Up Story Telling?
reviews.content:
Movies today seem to run into more trouble than I can ever remember. With politics, reshoots, budgets, fan pressure, and who knows what else, the art of making movies continues to be twisted into the former shelf of what it once was. With Covid 19 coming into the mix, the age of direct to streaming has opened up a new era of movie transformation and I shudder to think what the results will be given potential cuts to the film. Ranting aside, tonight's review is another direct to stream movie, and one with a lot of delay history on hand, as another book series is brought to life in hopes of making money. Will it work or once more are we sunk? Robbie K here ready to give you his thoughts as he reviews:Movie: Artemis Fowl (2020)Director:
Kenneth Branagh
Writers:
Conor McPherson (screenplay by), Hamish McColl (screenplay by)
Stars:
Ferdia Shaw, Lara McDonnell, Josh GadLIKES:Judy Dench
Josh Gad
Some of the Comedy
The Cinematography
Build For Family
The Music
The World BuildingDISLIKES:The Pace
The Forced Acting At Times
The Special Effects
The Cardboard Characters
How Quickly Resolved Things Are
The Political Correctness
Too Family Theme/Inconsistent
A Massive Set Up Movie Instead Of Its Own film
SUMMARY:Never having read the books, I went in pretty fresh thinking this would be Harry Potter meeting Men In Black with a bit of a family style added in. I believe on many levels my assumption was right and fortunately there were some heavy hitters leading the way. The stars for me were Dench and Gad, two actors who have their tricks for making the most of roles no matter how invested they are in the project. Dench's old school tactics and pot shots at age mix well with the "charm" of those she commands, a case of sensitive caring meeting dutiful officer entertaining to watch as she engaged with the new generation. Gad on the other hand continues to play his bumbling oaf of a snowman in a different form as the tricky dwarf who lives above the law in more ways than one. He seems to have fun with the role, and it's that energy that seems perfect for the character they developed for him. Gad acts as a focal point for the comedy, but Fowl's band of "criminals" sometimes have some tact to them that had me laughing at times, be it a well time one liner or maybe a sarcastic comment from Dench's character. It's all well themed and much like the rest of the movie has many "family themed elements" that I think Disney was going for in its countless troubles and directions with the film to which the target audience should love.
However, the strongest elements for this reviewer are the fact the more technical elements of the film that brought the world of fiction to life. For one thing, the music is great, despite having an AC unit blaring, the cinema design for Artemis' first journey is a splendid symphony of orchestral wonder that helps add excitement to the scenes at hand. More toned-down moments are complemented by a wonderful homage to Irish tradition with pipes, flutes, and the magical moor like tones bringing that fairy tale charm associated with Irish culture. This only further gets complemented by beautiful settings to which the cinematography captures beautifully and I for one was impressed with what they displayed on screen. As for the fantasy element, Disney continues to kick butt in this department as they always do. Computer design created a very elaborate world to get lost in be it the cramped halls of the Fowl manor with its hidden secrets, or the world of the fairy that dwells below the earth where science fiction and magic turn into a hybridized world that is both mystical and new edge. Add the costumes and character design into the mix, and you get that unique flare that Disney's money can make... when used right of course. I think many of your little ones will have some new trick or treat costumes this coming fall.Yet where marketing and splendor succeed, the movie fails for me at other parts. Like much of Disney's new family themed movies, the pace seems off for a typical Disney film as Artemis' journey sort of contorts to odd angles in an attempt to put everything into a journey to inspire every person under the sun. It's too fast for yours truly, giving many of the emotional moments a blunt edge that fails to tug at the heart strings it wants to pull so badly, the way Disney movies like to do. It does not help that the characters they tried to create are poorly developed, many having any dimension effectively ripped from them to make paper thin pawns for kids to aspire to be like. There are some redeeming qualities, I won't lie about that, but in terms of characters as a whole Disney's band is set for the adolescent minds instead of all families in general. It may also suffer from the fact that the actors are also still coming into their forte on this film. The young cast sort of has one or two dimensions and have not mastered the spectrum of acting that other actors have. Throw in some of the performances feel forced or not involved enough leading to less character utilization and the selling of this movie becomes harder and harder for me to do.
Maybe the plot and adventure aspect will be better and offset those limitations? After all Twilight has enough romance and fighting to make the film worth it right, right? No, the movie did not succeed on this aspect either for me. Artemis Fowl's limitations above carry over to this aspect of the film as well, leaving it a very skeletal framework with little sustenance for me. The adventure again is rushed, tense moments reduced to dry bouts of conversation, little build up, and action that has that modern-day family approved stamp that seems to plague so many films. Again those moments to grasp on to characters and worry about their fate become quick fix problems, where thirty seconds of an impasse show up and then resolves in some of the simplest story telling I've seen in a while. The action scenes start showing some pizazz, building up to Fowl's genius taking on this new world, only to quite in less than a minute. What happened to that magic we saw in Mulan, the lion king, Tarzan, and Toy Story, where the franchises were still to family, but were not afraid to add some darker elements to the mix. Fowl only does it with a few disturbing visuals, namely Gad dislocating his jaw, which would be more impressionable than a good action scene that actually uses its characters. An even weaker elements is how some of these fights sort have had technical jerkiness to it, like a DVD skipping, the scene would pause and then quickly speed up. While cool at some moments, it got overused and annoying for me, and felt like a distraction to the already limited scene.
The point this rambling makes is that the movie lacks intensity and connection to a majority of the audience, again too centered on the juvenile atmosphere that PG movies seem to have become. I also felt there was a little too much political agenda in this movie, not in the manner/degree we've seen in other films like Star Wars, Captain Marvel, and Charlie's Angels, but more like the Dream Big Princess campaign you see on Disney channel. It gets in the way of the storytelling for me and while inspirational, fans like me may lose faith in Disney putting plot development aside to stay politically relevant. Finally, this movie's inconsistencies sort of amplify that this rushed tale seems much like an intro chapter or installment to the book (which I do know enough for it to be the case), but in series like Percy Jackson and Harry Potter, those first stories also felt contained to their own tale as well. For Fowl though, the first installment focuses too much on the promise of a new series or movie coming in, perhaps another attempt to hypnotize into more toy sales. Had the other flaws not been so magnified in my eyes.The VERDICT:Artemis Fowl is cute and definitely the family friendly adventure theme that seems to be the new age of acceptable to many new parents. For this reviewer though, it gets in the way of bringing these young adult books to life, sheltering the intended audience from darker moments just to make a buck. Sure the acting will be good for the intended audience, and the music and visuals may be just the thing to hook you in to the film as you watch your children's eyes light up in delight (after all mine did for much of this film). However, the rushed plot, the forced acting, the lack of suspense, buildup, and intensity and trying to play too much in safe politics threw this film into disarray for me. While it certainly fits better on streaming rather than the theater, I can't help but wonder how much was lost to the numerous issues this film had with release. Yet, I worry even more that the studio I know can make out of this world films is losing their ability to story tell due to playing to the public interest movements. Nevertheless, I recommend this film for viewing at home of course, but take caution as some scenes may in fact be scary for those who are sensitive to the darker, more disturbing visuals.My scores overall are:Family, Fantasy, Adventure: 6.0
Movie Overall: 4.5

reviews.review_title: Again, IMDb struck my last review down because... reasons.
reviews.content: Artemis Fowl WANTED to be a new Harry Potter-like franchise but for Disney: the only problem was that the first film in this 'series' didn't excite anyone; at all. The script is shallow yet NEEDS more context for the characters and world it's showing us, the direction doesn't even feel like it actually came from Shakespearean actor Kenneth Branagh whatsoever, the effects look like they were from the early-2000s instead of 2020, and the music: it was piecemeal music fodder that riffed on every John Williams score ever made, all without having a standout piece of scoring at all.Right off the bat, this movie didn't get a theatrical release because it would have been massacred at the box office; and 2020's... life-changing epidemic didn't help matters either. Artemis Fowl is a Spy Kids movie that has a cast of characters wanting to have the same edginess as Batman; too bad they have no edge, or charm, here.Artemis Fowl gets 0.5/5 stars.It's a magnificently awful disaster of moviemaking. This is one 'for the books' absolutely. It does everything wrong, that it's an ideal education for what to avoid in moviemaking today.

I don't know what it was about this film, but it made me decide to start writing full reviews so hopefully it'll result in something good eventually...
I've never read the books, but I've heard this garbage has nothing to do with them which definitely doesn't surprise me, no one could have possibly ever wanted this film to happen if this is what they're like.
Put it this way: I, like many others, was disgusted by those two Percy Jackson films from a few years ago, based on a YA book series I have read and still enjoy, but this makes those look like The Lord of the Rings and No Country For Old Men in terms of adaptations.
This entire film feels like one long first act, where the stakes are expected to be low until the world opens up a bit and the full scope is revealed, and just as that is happening, the film ends. The "villain" of this film, we are assured, wants to blow up the world because of some reasons, and needs our macguffin of the day to do so, deciding that it would be a fantastic idea to leave the delivery of said macguffin to the child of the supposed real hero, who has no knowledge of fairies, the underground world, or much of anything that his father gets up to at all. Also, bet it took them a whole minute to come up with the design on that dude.
And that child...sweet god, I feel so bad for him. "I'm gonna be in a Disney film, I'm gonna work with Colin Farrell and Judi Dench, this'll be a great start to my career..."
...yes it would be fair to say I don't think it's going to work out that way.
I couldn't tell you whether his awful performance was even his fault or not, but I suspect he was probably the only person ever involved in this that ever cared at all. Unfortunately, that was not enough to save him from the ire of the screenwriter, who apparently decided that the best way of creating a relatable and likable protagonist was to make him Light Yagami but incomprehensibly MORE egotistical.
Nor was it enough to protect the other characters, most of whom sound like they have throat cancer for whatever reason and ALL of whom are drier than the tavern after St. Patrick's Day, or the abysmal effects, strange editing, and awful dialogue.
There aren't many films that I struggle to think of even one redeeming feature about, but there are even less that I cannot think of one redeeming feature about AFTER struggling to find one.
And just to make it perfectly clear, this film single-handedly made me start writing reviews, because it wasn't enough to just slap a 1/10 next to it.
Top of the morning, IMDB reviews.

I first watched the movie without having read the books and I really enjoyed it and disappointed with the critical reception.After I watched the movie, I read the first book for the first time and the movie is much closer with the story than these negative reviewers made me think. And the changes they did make don't bother me.I think the plan that the team had behind the movie was for this first film to be an origin story for Artemis becoming evil. The Ho Chi Minh scene (which is available in the extras tab) was going to be the scene that shows the audience that Artemis is willing to do whatever it takes to get to his goals. My major point was that if this was to become a franchise of movies, Artemis would be more similar to his book counterpart in future movies.IMO, you have to take the book and movie and look at it as 2 different ways to tell a similar story.Since it has had such a negative reaction, I'm disappointed that the chances of a sequel being greenlit is very low.

The plot develops way too fast. at the beginning it starts as something like harry potter, not for adults not for kids, something between. Soon it switches to something that I think is aimed at teenagers, but definitely when you watch you have the impression that this is a film for small children, although the nature of the plot is not for small for children. I don't know what they tried with this film but it's ruined, visual effects are ok but the story is pathetic and the choice of lead actors and their age limits even worse they way too young for such a serious development of the "situation" and this nature of the film!

reviews.review_title: Foul or Fowl, there's no "eggscaping" the missing Art in this!
reviews.content: An over-entitled brat, smart-mouthing his teachers and peers, loses his dad. His Butler helps the kid look for the Irish mug.Pretty simple concept, but in the wrong hands it could spiral to some far-fetched, outlandish scenarios that detract from the central theme. Yes, one theme! Simple!Add fairies, trolls and dwarves and you'd think you were in a Lord of the Rings offshoot, but then that central theme pops its head up and we're back to loathing this entitled teen! Knowing they're supposed to be bad, as the blurb states, and the news at the start informs us, doesn't excuse the repellent presence of Junior! Senior is bearable, although hardly seen!Surely this was one instalment of a few, as so many loose ends are left undone! But I can understand why the rest weren't made. The fowl doesn't make an appearance, but the foul act of Artemis sure does!

reviews.review_title: A film that doesn't need a sequel.
reviews.content: Artemis Fowl. A film that doesn't need a sequel. This is the only film at the moment that I did not like so much. Only names remain of the wonderful books. Characters under these names are almost 100% inconsistent with what they should be. It's sad that one of my favorite book series got this adaptation.

reviews.review_title: Good action flick based on the books
reviews.content: If you want a movie that is just like the books don't watch this movie it's not for you. If you are interested in a new story based on the books then you are in for a great time. This is a fun story with a lot of action and amazing visual effects that shouldn't be taken too seriously. The story does feel a little rushed at times and the rules on how humans and fairies should interact isn't explained, which can lead to some confusion. But overall the plot is easy to follow and keeps you entertained. The movie is definitely made for a younger audience and it gives kids what they want.

reviews.review_title: Calling this garbage is a compliment!
reviews.content: After watching this movie I have absolutely no intentions to read the book thanks a lot.

reviews.content:

I watched it & I enjoyed it. It's a decent watch for a kid movie. The girl who plays Holly Short was good, the boy playing the titular character; not so much & Judi Dench clearly doesn't care anymore.P.S. - I haven't read the books & I don't intend to.

I am going to start off this review by being quite blunt; in my most sincerest of opinions, "Artemis Fowl" is quite possibly the worst Disney movie ever produced. I am confident that there has to be a direct-to-DVD movie that is objectively worse than "Artemis Fowl", but the fact that the latter is a big budget release and is comparable to the former is honestly baffling to me. "Artemis Fowl" is atrocious in every capacity and quite literally in every aspect; from the character's bland and uninteresting development and general lack of intrigue, to the scarcity of unique and interesting locations, to the failed captivation of the mysterious villain who, by the way, is only seen in three scenes, all of which very concise and underwhelming. What I cannot fathom as well is the story's own premise; like why does every character in this movie want the McGuffin? Unfortunately, we as audience members never quite get to find out this necessary bit of information because "Artemis Fowl" insists on going at break-neck pace, meaning that nothing gets sufficiently explained and nothing gets sufficiently developed, including the characters. What is even more perplexing is the fact that "Artemis Fowl" is so boring, despite the fact that so much happens at an incredible speed. Overall, "Artemis Fowl" is an F and a generous 1/10.

I know this film is based in a book, but I certainly think it should have stayed there.First, presenting a clever boy as some kind of god may be interesting between the lines of a whole saga of books, expecting him with some 'human' facts from him of course, but this film decides to throw that essential part of our little lead boy, Artemis, making him unbearable to watch without cringing.He's so annoying and there's no possible way to relate with him and his story since he doesn't have flaws like the audience, that's the glow that the writers put on their characters naturally, and by this time of the cinema industry I thought that was a tool used as common sense.Besides having flat and annoying characters, this film seems like a 'decent special effects' version of Spy Kids, but please don't ever think this film is funny or intriguing like the iconic saga of Robert Rodriguez, that saga was ridiculous, and they know it, meanwhile... Artemis Fowl was made thinking this was a good version of Spy Kids, a movie that not even children would like since it's too serious for a kid lead role.In conclusion, this is an incoherent movie that doesn't quite entertain the audience, it is not for a fan of the books or anyone that hasn't read them. I'm giving it a three just because I liked how it looked with the huge house, the beach, some customs and the CGI. That's it.

reviews.review_title: Why even attach the name Artemis Fowl to this?
reviews.content:
5 minutes into the movie and it has already ruined the whole idea of who Artemis is by having him surf.
2 minutes later and his mother is dead while his mother being mentally ill plays a major role in later books.
1 minute after that and Artemis is doing air tricks on a OneWheelI unfortunately can go on like this for pretty much every minute of the movie. IT misses every single point of what made the books so well liked and why the figure of Artemis Fowl was such a breath of fresh air in Kids/YA literature. He's not a boy who does cool stuff, dreams of faeries and just happens to be smart. He's not a hero setting out to rescue his father, he's a cold, calculated, criminal mastermind who pulled a heist on the Faerie folk.I doubt anybody who was involved in this script has read more than the blurb on the back of the books or was interested in making this an actual series of movies as they completely ruined several important plot lines from the books within the first 20 minutes of the movie.I really don't have the energy to even go into the poor CGI, phoned in performances and middle of the road, crammed in Irish references. This is a terrible, terrible movie and I can only hope that in a decade it get's a proper remake like The Golden Compass had.

I heard a lot of rave about this film in the radio and Decided to watch it last night! Honestly it's terrible! Was so confused throughout and most of the acting was terrible! Definitely one of the worst films I have seen in a long time!

Not amazing not awful some of the comments on here seem to be expecting a shindlers list style movie 😂😂

This is the 2nd worst Disney movie I have ever seen & I have seen most of them. The only good things about this movie is the CGI & the sound as I feel sorry for the people in the film who worked hard on this total rubbish.How Disney allow these dreadful scripts to be made into movies is beyond me as before you even start to actually get to make a Disney film the first part should be to get the script written & to make it make sense as a film script.For some reason Disney seem to think that getting a door film script is not important so whomever approved this dreadful film script ( adapted terribly from the book ) should be fired as they really let everyone down badly.This film kind of does pretty much everything wrong ( except for the special effects CGI people who you can't blame ).The casting is dreadful as the actors chosen are either square pegs in round holes or just simply some of the worst actors you can find who then are given a terrible script ( as to be fair even good actors would struggle with this ),Kenneth Branagh directed this & this must be the worst film he has ever directed as really he should have seen it was going terribly & insisted the movie script must be re-written as now his name is attached to this really awful movie & who would want to watch another film he dares direct now?At some point let us hope Disney see where they are going wrong & realise in future before they truly invest in a project they must first ensure they have an excellent film script & then employ people with a proven track record of excellence ( not give the wrong people the power to employ film directors, hire cast & worse of all hire terrible writers & then worse use those scripts ).Just like adults, children are not idiots & will not enjoy this kind of rubbish.Disney are really making huge mistakes with the wrong people in charge.

reviews.review_title: Had to create an account just to give this movie a bad review.
reviews.content: This is one of the greatest film atrocities Disney had ever committed. reviews.review_title: Eoin Colfer, please choose better who you sell you rights to next time
reviews.content: Let me start by a simple statement.This film was an absolute butchery of a wonderful piece of literature. This failure is equal if not higher than the one of Eragon(2006). At least Eragon roughly held the profiles of its characters.In this abomination, however, they, for reasons unknown, turned all characters upside down.To be perfectly clear: I am not criticising actors And their performances here. My wrath goes directly to the creative team.Also to list couple of good things about this film: the costumes and props were great. Nice attention to details, well designed etc. (not counting the cage where Holly was held). And the VFX was nice. But that's about it.Now to the scolding:Holly Short is supposed to be the first female LEP recon officer and a lot of the story actually revolves around this fact.Also she is supposed to be 80odd years old (which was actually mentioned in the film) and she was supposed to look like a young adult(which definitely wasn't).Next on the list: Why they killed Angeline Fowl???? She was a side plot of the whole first book and an important figure in most of the others.Foul sr. Should have been lost at sea, and not kidnapped by a fairy. He was supposed to be held in captivity by a russian mafia. It would be probably understandable to put in kidnapping as a dramatic enhancement, but they took a bad guy from another volume and transplanted her into this abomination of an adaptation of the first book.And now we get to the Butler. Where to start?The book clearly states that Butler is supposed to reveal his first name only if he is about to die(which he does in one of the books). The film reveals it straight away asking us to call him by his first name only.Also in the book he is described as large man of Eurasian descent which makes him inconspicuous everywhere. I wouldn't mind filmmakers casting a black man, that can be justified. But what's with that hair and eyes? Can anyone, please, explain, why they made him look like a black aryan?His sister (yes, it was supposed to be a sister, not a niece) was supposed to be a typical teenager (few years older than Artemis).And now to the main culprit of this failure. The main character himself. Artemis Foul.The casting here was actually very good. They could barely find a better suiting actor. But sadly that is the only positive thing I can say.Wearing his tailored suit from the beginning of the books, he always protested wearing casual clothing. And the film shows him in a bloody sweatshirt. And that dramatic gesture when he says I need a suit was probably the worst writing I've ever seen (and yes, I do count The Room).He is supposed to be a criminal mastermind. So why he isn't??In the film they really tuned down the genius of Artemis Foul II. He barely even thinks throughout the whole film. In the book he was a genius with published works on multiple scientific subjects (including psychology) he was always scheming and plotting and that was what made the books so good. The film portrayed him just as a clever kid. When he said I'm a criminal mastermind at the end of the film, my only reaction was: Why??? How can he say that when he never did any masterminding except saying "I have a plan" couple of times?He was not supposed to go to school in the first book. He did attend in the second book, but only as a direct consequence of something that happened at the end of the first book, which brings us nicely to Angeline Fowl.There are many more crimes against good judgement, storytelling, adaptation and other fields of good cinematography, but this lament is getting too long.I can't but wonder if they have any plans for the future, because the way they made this torture device they can kiss goodbye the second book (unless they want to revive dead Angeline instead of rescuing kidnapped father again).The bottom line is: technically well done movie with a terrible story and even worse adaptation value.The only truly positive thing I can say about this film is that they didn't kill the mood by shoving a nasty out-of-context song at the beginning of end credits.Mr. Colfer, Me and (I hope) most of your fans would be very much grateful, if you could wrestle the rights out of the hands of Disney and sold them (probably for much more money now ;-) ) to someone, who will be able to make a film that is worthy of your style of writing.

I can guarantee this would have bombed in the box office. It was smart of Disney to move this to Disney+; even if the pandemic hadn't it they might have anyways.
As much as this literally pulls straight from Men In Black and Harry Potter, this film pales in comparison to those other franchises. Honestly, I think this would have been better as a series so that more of the story and world could be properly explored. This seemed to also be like the brutal remake of Ghostbusters in the sense that here we have characters new to the world they have discovered yet figure out how to use their weapons in seconds. This isn't a bad film but definitely misses the mark that I'm sure Disney was hoping for.

reviews.review_title: What the hell was this mess???
reviews.content: Complete mess! Not fun or enjoyable in anyway. The story is so boring and nonsensical. Feels like it was made by 20 different people with all different ideas. Hated it.

I keep seeing the trailer for this film and thinking, "Wow, that looks good, I should watch that." and then about half way through the trailer I remember, I have already watched that, and it was terrible. I honestly don't understand how someone cut that trailer out of the movie, put more story, content and interest into 30 seconds than the film can raise in ~90 minutes. I understand it needed to be reduced to children's level and a lot of exposition was required to make sense of the universe for non-readers but really I don't get how this movie is such a mess.

I had high hopes for this film as I loved the books. Book adaptations are always tricky and rarely hit the expectations of readers. This movie does not follow the book but does pick essential bits out and the bits I did notice made me smile, Mulches bum flap for one. There is so much in the books to get across that they could never have achieved it in one film especially if you've built up a specific image for the characters from reading. I did enjoy the film and it has been set up for a sequel should they decide to make one, which I hope they do. If you want a perfect rendition of the books you will be disappointed but if you want a nice film based on characters from the book then it's ok. The best way of describing it for me would be that it's more like The Hobbits adaption for film than Lord of the Rings was.

This was a complex story which seemed to overwhelm its own running time. As a result I was largely confused by what was happening and why; the lack of character development did not help in this. Why was it necessary to engineer the arrest and interrogation of Josh Gad's character? Why were humans, Artemis and co., not affected by the time freeze? Why did the lead heavy not foresee the risk that the maguffin could be used against it? And so on.In its favour, the visuals were spectacular. It did not take itself too seriously. And Josh Gad provided welcome knowing comic relief. Plus, significantly for me, I stayed awake throughout; this was not boring.Maybe the story is better suited to an episodic format to better and more comprehensively do its labyrinthine plot justice. Or maybe we should treat it as an expensive trailer for the source material. Sometimes books are best left as books.

I don't know where to begin. Obviously it's supposed to be a kids movie so maybe the entire thing was way out of my range but there were so many monumental failings, it's impossible to ignore after so much hype.I was under the impression Artemis Fowl (jr) was the main character. He comes across as a bit part. Judi Dench and Lara McDonnell are the headliners with Colin Farrell bringing up the rear. Perhaps a better, more experienced child actor could have been an improvement as Artemis Foul but honestly, the writing was so bad it probably made no difference, It was cliche after cliche with some embarrassing "cool kids" lingo chucked in to enhance the cringe factor even more.
Mechanically operated fairies that live under the sea...was that in the book ?? I swear some of the puppets were straight out of the 1982 Jim Henson catalog !
Pure garbage apart from the opening scenes in Ireland.

reviews.review_title: What a mess in terms of writing, acting and cgi
reviews.content: What a pile of garbage, who comes up with a script like this, the performance of the actors is atrocious as well. The overdone use of cgi is just as bad, I really can't see anything good in this movie, it's just one of the worst of 2020

For those watching the movie without reading the book, will enjoy this. However those that have read the books will probably have mixed emotions.I'm somewhat basing this review on the fact if nobody has read the book.Artemis doesn't come across as an criminal mastermind, clearly he is simply a smart young boy on a mission to save his father. The plot itself feels a bit mixed between the two books, and whilst we knew this was going to happen, it still feels weird how they mixed it in.I loved the way they introduced Mulch Diggums, and how he introduced us the story of Artemis Fowl. At first, I thought he look more "Human" than dwarf but by the mid way point I was somewhat content.To the directors credit, they did keep some of the events and wording from the book, and whilst they changed the plot around the books the plot was passable.The characters choices were very good. Even Commander Root being female worked really well.I absolutely LOVED Haven City! they really got that nailed. Along with the shoots, and all the creatures. Foaly was a little bit different to what I imagined however he still did the job.When I saw the troll, I was really happy with how they created the creature.To all those wanting to watch the movie that have seen the book, go in watching and expect it to be a little bit different.Thanks for reading!
Wow how could they get the adaption so wrong! Everything that made the book great is undone. Poor story, script, casting, direction. Hopefully left on Disney plus and forgotten

For everyone that had to associate their name with this movie, and anyone that watched the complete film like I did because of how much they were excited for an Artemis Fowl movie. This was truly an awful adaptation.

Oh Judy! Judy Judy Judy! What on earth where you thinking!I nearly turned myself inside out cringing watching it! The only reason we carried on watching it was that we'd promised the kids a movie night!Utterly disastrous movie!

I know I'm jumping on the hate bandwagon here, but I just can't understand why you would adapt a beloved book series into a film and completely ignore the what is in the books?! Do production companies just care about drawing you into see the film, and not care that we are all going to hate the film? Do they not care about actually making a decent film anymore?! Is it just all opening numbers and profit sheets and as long as they lure enough people in initially to pay for the stupid movie, they don't care whether we like it or not?!And why change it? What metrics do they use that suggest to them that completely changing the characters and storyline is a good plan? I know not everything in a book can be adapted
to film and things need to be shortened and changed a little to make it work, but honestly, why change the whole thing?! Do they truly think they can do it better than the source material? How often does that work?! The book is almost always better.This is not Artemis Fowl, this is 'loosely based' on Artemis Fowl, they have completely changed the character, his motivations and most of the things that make this book series so fantastic. It's boring and by the numbers. It must be so disappointing for authors like Eoin Colfer to see their books turned into these terrible films! If only every author had as much clout as JK Rowling.I have given this a couple of stars only because some of the performances were good, despite the terrible script and story they were working with. Josh Gad and the actress playing Holly did a solid job trying to work with this terrible mush.I hope this doesn't make Disney buckets of money just because it's going to draw in fans of the books, they don't deserve it.

reviews.review_title: Nice movie, don't care about others critics!

reviews.review_title: Why cant you just do an adaptation RIGHT??
reviews.content: Every aspect of this film either feels rushed or amateur. And those are all of the positives.No clear story to follow, the characters are so underdeveloped that some times I even forgot some of them where part of the main story. reviews.review_title: I guess I get some of the hate, but I think it is taken way too far.

reviews.review_title: A poor attempt at a film adaptation
