Before I was even 30 minutes into the movie, I could have written a whole page on what went wrong. The plot was totally different from that of the book (if I am remembering correctly), along with several character descriptions being completely thrown out the window. Also, in the movie Artemis is not portrayed as a criminal, even though the books clearly describe him as "a criminal mastermind."I was hoping that we would get a good adaptation for Artemis Fowl. But we did not. Maybe we'll get a tv series or something that is true to the books.

reviews.review_title: Lots of potential but needs redirection moving forward
reviews.content: I read all of the Artemis Fowl books as a kid and I loved all of them, so I was very excited to see a film adaptaion made. I watched it without reading any reviews so I went into this movie with an open mind. I honestly thought the first act, while it had a muddled pacing, was actually quite good. It did a good job introducing the world and I began to feel excited and nostalgic about delving into this world once again. Moving into the second and third act however, the plot started to lose me and I felt like any meaningful character development stopped. I did not have a problem with some of the character changes that others seemed to have (eg. Commander Root being a woman, Juliet being the niece instead of the sister) but it became clear that there was much more emphasis on the McGuffin chase and just lost my interest. I do not however agree that this is the worst adaptation ever made that others seem to think. The books were targeting an age group of preteen children and that seemed to be the same demographic that Disney was targeting with this movie. Perhaps it's because all of the fans of this book series are probably adults like myself that I'm seeing so much disappointment with this movie, because it clearly wasn't made for us. I think Disney needs to figure out who will be wanting to watch this franchise if they are going to move on with sequels but personally, I would very much love to see The Arctic Incident with some improvements that Disney will hopefully learn from the reception of this film.

True fans will never win. Why can't they just base it on the books? The flaw is that Disney thinks they can outwrite what was originally written by Eoin Colfer is annoying. It's like Disney doesn't even try anymore - recent movies are no more than a jumbled up story with one developed character and everyone else being thrown to the side. This movie does quite the same. I can see where they tried, but you will be disappointed if you are a fan of the original book series.
It's just Disney. I'm not surprised. Disney is now a very large company known worldwide. They don't even have to try anymore. This is an example of Disney being lazy and uninspired.
Take a look at the How To Train Your Dragon series from Dreamworks. They steered almost completely clear of the original plot and still managed to deliver. How? Because Dreamworks knows how. The plot is it's own while still being respectful to the original piece.
Disney on the other hand is almost always there for the money. The plot is lazy and is full of cliches. Don't watch if you are a fan of the original book. If you have no idea what Artemis Fowl is, give this movie a try. You might like it if I have to be honest, but for the fans, they pushed us aside once again.
Thanks for taking the time to read this.

reviews.review_title: Wow, just wow (not in a good way!)
reviews.content: I'm trying to work out if this is the worst film I've ever seen or not. It's definitely in the top 3, or should I say bottom 3. From the cringe-worthy Irish accents (including from Irish actors, who were no doubt told their actual Irish accents didn't sound "Oirish" enough for the US audience) to the disjointed storyline, from the dislikeable characters to the pointlessness of it all.I haven't read the books but my son has. He just said "the books were a lot better" - that's coming from a kid who'll watch anything that moves on a TV screen.I don't like being so negative so in a search for positives, the only one I came up with was it's only 96 minutes long. Boy does it feel longer though - days longer.Don't let the big names fool you. Don't think that because the books were good that the film will be. Don't think that Disney films are always watchable. There is no reason on earth to watch this film. Do anything else instead.

I know I'm in the minority, but I enjoyed this film. Perhaps because I'm a huge fan of the series of books. Perhaps because I'm a huge fan of Eoin Colfer who wrote the book. Either way, I enjoyed it. Would have made a terrific t.v. series.

While I have never read the books before, there was some serious talent both behind and in front of the camera. The director was Kenneth Branagh, and the movie starred Judi Dench, Colin Farrell, and Josh Gad. Unfortunately for both the movie and the viewing audience, this talent was wasted. Dench and Farrell gave good performances as the fairy military commander and Artemis Sr. respectively, but Josh Gad was incredibly annoying throughout the movie. He tried to do his best William Shatner impression but failed. His overacted, pretentious reading as the dwarf narrator was one of the many faults in this movie. Josh Gad was also miscast as a dwarf, mainly because of his height. The movie tried to cover it up with a series of tall dwarf jokes that consistently fail to land, like the majority of the so-called jokes. The character development was also lacking. We don't learn until the tail end of the movie that Artemis is a criminal mastermind. And, finally, the script has way too many holes. First, it never bothers to tell the audience what organization interviewed Josh Gad. How will the Fowls overcome its new media image? And, how can an effective army, which should rely on a clear and unbreakable command structure, have a captain overrule a decision of a commanding officer? Overall, 4/10 stars. Its unbearable for viewers who have not read the books and I'm sure it is even more so for dedicated fans of the series.

It's the biggest waste of potential to come out of Hollywood in decades and that's such a shame since we *should* have a series of films based on the Artemis Fowl books, but this disaster of a film might just have put paid to that.Such a shame.

Watched this last night and it made me thankful that the current pandemic forced it straight to VOD as if had paid for a ticket to watch thos at the cinema, I would be asking for my money back.Calling this Artemis Fowl is an insult to Eoin Colfer.
To say this is based on the book is a joke, it simply borrows the character names and a couple of features and then barbarically cobbles together a sham of a story.The acting was okay, but amazing, but if it had been a decent story I could have dealt with it, but what I cannot deal with:Changing Root to female. Why? Did the director feel they didn't have enough strong female characters? What about Holly, second in importance only to Artemis himself in the first book. And Juliet Butler, she develops into a very strong character. As good as Judi Dench is, she did not need to be in this film, certainly not as Julius Root.Butler. "Whatever you do, dont call him the Butler". When I saw that Nonso Anozie was cast, I was excited to see a good representation for the complex character, bit this was not the case at all. The film has you believe that the bodyguard to Artemis Fowl jr, who is barely seen considering he is essentially attached to Artemis in the books, does not get called Butler, bit instead by his first name. The literal opposite of how it actually was in the books. There was no need at all to change this in the film, it served no importance to the plot.The Aculos. Another item not needed. Why it couldn't follow the plot of the book is beyond me, it was exciting enough that it generated an entire series of books after it.All in all, if it wasnt for a few sections of the film that made me laugh in a good way, I would have given this one star, but the filmmakers should thank Josh Gad as Mulch Diggums for the second.I would not recommend watching this film. Definitely not if you have read and enjoyed the books, but also not even if you haven't because it is not that enjoyable as a standalone.

This movie was just strange, when i saw the overwhelmingly negative reviews i thought i would hate this movie when i watched it but i don't. Yes it's a bad movie but almost everything about it was strange.Let's start of with the good. Well Lara McDonnell gave a decent performance as Holly Short, her character had an underdeveloped plot but i liked her performance in the movie. I know i'm in the minority in this but i mostly liked Josh Gad in this movie, yes the narration was unneeded, the grouchy voice was annoying (it's even addressed in the movie) and some of the scenes involving his CGI use was horrible but i enjoyed the charisma and witt he brought in the movie. He played as a tall dwarf and he looked like the only one having fun in that movie so yeah Josh Gad was a silver lining.The concept and potential was there and interesting as well, the first act was not that bad as you are introduced to the other worlds of Artemis Fowl like the fairy kingdom was an interesting concept and the CGI was decent early in the movie too but that potential was never realized. Being a Kenneth Branagh movie some shots looked nice and well directed AT TIMES with some decent set pieces here and there.Now the Bad. Ferdia Shaw who played Artemis Fowl had a hammy performance throughout the movie, at times he seemed too monotone and stoic and the other he seemed to be over-acting, it wasn't a terrible performance as he got a lot better during the third act but that was one of the many problems of the movie. Another problem was how scenes seemed to be stitched together and all over the place. Not to give anything away but the majority of the movie takes place in a House.The runtime is 1hr 30 minutes and it seems some scenes were removed and the pacing was too fast and dodgy as you're not given time to fully flesh out characters and the runtime is just filled with exposition and world building but you're never given time to care about the characters or the plot. Judy Dench also gave a weird performance with a grouchy voice, The CGI got bad real fast and this is a big budget movie mind you especially with some bad action sequences.The heist aspect of the movie took a backseat as most of it was explained through narration which took away any thrill or suspense. The villain was awful as he/she has a generic motivation to take over the world and i don't mind that but there is no backstory or any reason to be invested in the villain so it just ends up being generic movie bad guy 101 oh and he/she has a grouchy voice, i have no idea why this movie had an obsession with grouchy voices.Colin Farrell as Artemis' father had the potential to be an interesting character but as soon as you're introduced to him, he is immediately gone. The adventure aspect is also poorly executed and the way how the main conflict is resolved is just baffling.Like i said the whole movie was strange, Also some scenes drag on and we are talking about a 1hr 30 minute movie here and the story never goes to interesting places and again you never care for the characters. So overall, didn't hate his movie, but it's not a good movie by any means.

reviews.review_title: Nice Cinematics, weak story, and tone deaf movie
reviews.content:
Artemis Fowl is a standard Disney movie, the cinematic, the music, the costume, most of the actors, all were superb. From the beginning to end, the movie goes smooth and it kind of managed to end the story.
However, not sure whatever the reason, the story really sucked. After watching for more than an hour or so, I kind of felt that the whole movie didn't have any good story. The whole story could be told in two to three lines. Also, the movie had lots of 'filler' actions, actions were added to make the movie longer, instead of contributing to the story. There were many unanswered questions, many contradictory statements.
Now, the main actor, he was a young boy, he tried his best. But, he was overdramatic, it was clear that sometimes he was walking or behaving too dramatic for the sake of the camera. At the end, even if he was a genius, he made a rookie mistake! Of course, you need to watch the movie, regardless how bad it is, to find that mistake!
At the end, while Black Lives Matter and the protest against anti-Black racism and stereotype are going on, this movie made it clear that Disney actually supported slavery and black stereotype (in England, in modern days, only Servant in the movie was Black). Except giving the guy blue eyes, also another tone-deaf approach to show that blue eyes are better than original black eyes of the Black folks, his only role in the movie was to serve, and listen to a white kid with questionable judgement. The master of the house was multi-generational rich and white person, and most probably a big supporter of slavery. Just like Mulan, a movie to please the Commies, Disney released another tone-deaf movie exactly proving the point that systematic racism exists in mainstream media.

reviews.review_title: I refuse to believe that Kenneth Branagh directed this
reviews.content: This film is incredibly awful. Just 2 or three shots of the teaser trailer are in the movie. They basically shot a trailer. The young actor that played Artemis Fowl II (Ferdia Shaw), this is his first ever credit on IMDb. I feel so bad for this kid. This is a terrible performance. It feels amateur in every way. It feels like whenever he gets one of his lines out his face locks up. It's downright cringey and embarrassing. The worst part of this movie is that it feels like it has no story. The core story of this movie is that Artemis Fowl sr. (Colin Farrel) is kidnapped. Whoever kidnapped him wants this thing that would give him infinite story. It's a giant MacGuffin that everyone wants. So Artemis Fowl II has to find this thing so he can get his dad back. That's what the film is about summarized on paper, but that's not what the movie's about. The movie has no idea what it is about. Josh Gad narrates almost the entire movie. The first six minutes is nothing but exposition and it continues so heavy-handed throughout the entire film because they don't know how to condense this story into 94 minutes (super short). Our main character is supposed to be liked by everyone, but he is super annoying and not interesting. Because of that you don't really care about what he's doing. This is easily in the top 10 worst live action Disney movies ever made. This is barely a movie. It's barely a story. If you're a fan of these novels, you're probably going to hate this. This is more of a spy kids movie than an Artemis Fowl movie. Keep in mind that this movie cost $125 million, directed by someone who has directed good films in the past and has talented people in it. For some reason it feels like a stack of scenes strung together to last 94 minutes. It doesn't feel like it has story, charcters, or any compelling elements. It just feels like a property that has been given a feature film treatment. It's so bad and very dissapointing.

This movie really wasn't the best and felt quite rushed and had so much more potential so I'm going to try and keep this as short as possible but I do have to go over so many things so I will therefore bullet point these things with an explanation to why I have listed them.Acting:Artemis Foul/ The main character:
The acting in this film was just plain awful in my opinion. It all just felt too forced from more or less, every character. The main boy just showed no emotion and just sounded monotone throughout the entire film. Now I understand that the child is young and acting is extremely hard especially playing this type of role and I do not want to seem like I'm blasting a child's performance but there are younger actors who can preform well beyond this such as the entire cast of the comedy Good Boys or even one of the main boys from that film, Jacob Tremblay and his performance in films such as Wonder or Room. Now the film Stormbreaker didn't really smash the box office but Alex Pettyfers acting in the film is how this kid should have acted in Atermis Foul. Alex actually showed emotion and facial expressions which made you connect more with the character and felt like you was watching a film rather than what seemed like a fan made film or trailer.Domovoi/Butler:
This character was just naff, he tried so hard to be the big tough bad ass but it just failed especially during scenes that was meant to be funny or heartfelt. I seemed like he was trying to hard to be the type of character that Dave Bautista played in GotG or the secret agent from Lilo and Stitch. You know, the character that is just completely bad ass and seems like the rough and tough character but when they do something that doesn't fit that role it's either really funny or actually quite sweet but this is because the characters don't force either or these things on you and it's all natural where as this actor and the character just tried to hard to make you think he was the guy made of steel with no emotions then tried to force these comedic or emotional scenes onto you.Now the only 2 characters that were any sort of decent were the higher up celebrities such as Josh Gad or Colin Farrell but even these were mediocre at best. I think I chuckled twice at Gad's character but other than that it was poor. The constant narrating by Gad was just annoying, distracting and got a bit repetitive with the constant play on how "cool" Artemis was and how he was the best, to be honest this all felt like the little movies you get playing on the small TV's while waiting in a line for a horror/scary rollercoaster or those interactive horror mazes. Every time one of these scenes ended and Gad finished narrating I felt like it was time to go into the next room. Also must point out that Dame Judi Dench must be at the lowest of the low after Cats and now this, to put it blunt, she was awful and honestly just seemed like she did not want to be there or in the movie at all.The plot: (potential spoilers)
Now this is based only on the film and nothing to do with the book.
The plot was...meh...it felt a tad rushed and got boring throughout the majority of the film if I'm honest and my partner felt the same. Now the effects in the film weren't too bad at all and was probably the main reason I continued to watch as they were impressive it was just a shame the story was a bit...slow? I think that's probably the best way to describe it. There was quite some action but it felt like instead of this Artemis character actually doing anything that would deem him a cool action hero, they just forced that he was this kind of character by telling you he was. It seemed every time he done something, they had to focus on this and add some slow motion like when he drops a glass of milk for instance. But he falls short of the hero by getting his butler killed (more or less), taking his sweet time killing that massive troll and nearly failing to rescue his father on time. All in all, I did not enjoy the film and I felt like it was just slow, quite boring and the acting was terrible. Could see this becoming a more serious, mature Netflix series over time which would put this to complete shame. Ah well each to their own.

It's a cliche to say the book was better. But it really was. This movie was so bad it actually tainted the memory of Eoin Colfer's excellent series. I heartily recommend you purchase the books instead, read them, and never watch this rubbish. Even if you get it free, you're still wasting your time and ruining a good read. I always thought the series was so visually descriptive and imaginative that it was just crying out for a film franchise. But somehow Disney took a gift brief and utterly stuffed it. Mulch Diggums should've been great but they made him a Hagrid clone who ends up clumsily narrating the whole story because the film-makers were too lazy or stupid to write a decent script. Dame Judy Dench is utterly wasted. Colin Farrell likewise. Neither have much to do but plod through heavy handed exposition. The titular Artemis Fowl is poorly acted and somehow they wrote out a lot of the reasons the character was so well loved. Throughout the books he's a bit of a nerd - and proud of it. He's the brains not the brawn - a positive role model to young kids who are more academic than sporting. But no. The opening scene has Artemis surfing like a pro and jumping a hoverboard. Later he fires a laser gun like he's been doing it all his life. Very disappointing. And so much for the 'little people'. Obviously budget didn't stretch to scaling pixies and leprechauns down because they were all adult size - just a set of pointy ears and done. Imagine if the Hobbits in Lord of the Rings were just people size. Half the charm is that they're little yet make a big difference. It's just lazy. Only a smattering of terrible CGI... I don't even know what they were - gnomes?? reminded us of the rich vein of legends and stories this movie steadfastly refuses to acknowledge. This was most evident in Holly who looked like a child, not a small adult. And Judy who was large and in charge as Commander Root - a curmudgeonly male in the book. Folley is horribly over-acted. Butler and his daughter are an awful token effort to inject some coloured actors. It feels forced and yeah, nice work Disney, you made him the butler. The ubiquitous CG effects give the whole thing a synthetic look. It felt like a horrible mishmash of early 90's Marvel movies and the worst bits of Harry Potter - filmed entirely on blue screen sets with stagey lighting. Aaarrg. I could go for hours. Just take my word for it and go read the books. Like the prequel Star Wars movies - forget this film exists or it'll ruin the previous material for you.

After several delays and a cancelled cinematic release, Artemis Fowl arrives on Disney+ today. The film sees Artemis Fowl (Ferdia Shaw), a young criminal prodigy, hunts down a secret society of fairies to find his missing father (Colin Farrell).Having never read any of the novels or knowing the source material aside from the name, I didn't have an emotional or already existing investment in the source material, so this film didn't irritate from that perspective like it has done to the fans (due to the negative reactions to the trailers and the reviews of this film). No, Artemis Fowl irritates me purely from a filmmaking and narrative perspective and for wasting 96 minutes of my life on its boring, convoluted, poorly written, blatant sequel/universe set up story, poor performances of uninteresting and irritating characters and a laughable production value at times.The story is a choppy mess, in which the writers clearly didn't know whether they wanted to make a straight up origin story or an original tale in which the characters are established. Instead the film attempts to do both, as well as craft a launching platform for a sequel (which I guarantee won't happen). There is so much lore, terminology, locations and name drops thrown at the screen with 90% of the dialogue being expository, of which is delivered insufferably by Josh Gad's character in a ridiculous and grating gravelly voice. The villain (I honestly don't think they even name them and they never even interact with Artemis) motivation is utterly boring and lacks any depth. The pacing is terrible, due to the lack of plot focus the film feels far longer than its 96 minute runtime.Visually the film varies wildly from at times decent CGI and a bold colour palette to a low budget TV show set design and awful special effects. This is the same with costume and prosthetic designs that vary from fairly impressive to tacky and garish. The purely CGI characters have a bizarre frame rate and almost blur around them which is especially prevalent in the Troll battle sections in which the choreography is a complete mess, with poor editing and lacks thrills. The last battle you will have seen so many times before and done better in other similar genre films.The performances are basically all bad. I don't want to be too harsh on the child actors but they are awful here, Artemis lacks any personality or presence, and whenever he and the other kids have dialogue it normally descend into shrieking annoyance. Josh Gad is the 'comic relief' and exposition machine. He gives an unfunny and cringe inducing performance with his voice at times switching tone from line to line. Colin Farrell completely phones in the 3 or 4 scenes he is in and Judi Dench is laughable as the deep voiced (it rivals Gad's) leader of the fairies.Artemis Fowl is an utter waste of time, a boring, convoluted, uninspired, annoying chore that Disney have thrown onto their streaming service because it would have completely bombed in cinemas. More like 'Artemis Fail'.

I don't really get the very low ratings. OK, it's not the Blade Runner, but it's from Disney, so what do you expect?
I didn't know the story before, so no judgment from that. I found it fairly entertaining, if you don't take it too seriously.
Still much better than The Rise of Skywalker - and for the fraction of the cost.

Josh Gad is not funny, no matter how many times this movie tries to make you believe it. His narration adds nothing to the story, and only serves to make you more and more irritated the longer you are forced to hear his attempted Batman impression. Nothing involving this character is even remotely funny.I have never read the book, but now I have no desire to even try. The acting was very lacking and the kid was a prick. Colin Farrell is very wasted in this movie, and we barely got to know him before he disappeared. The characters had no personality. Listening to the dialogue was like putting my head in a metal grinder. There was no sense of wonder regarding the magic, and it was a very boring story.Overall, it was a waste of my time. It would have been better as a show. For the love of everything good in this world I hope they don't make a sequel.

I had to review this 46 minutes after watching.
It hadn't been so good for those who have read the book...
Myself, I haven't read the book but I wasn't connected to the characters at all. It will be a great movie for those who enjoy unrealistic movies like, "Attack Of A Killer Tomatoes", "The Gingerdead Man" and on.I didn't hate the movie neither did I like it.

reviews.review_title: This movie didn't know what it wanted to be.
reviews.content: They had no idea what to do with this story or how to tell it. The one character that was remotely likable was kind of pushed to the background and the main character who they wanted you to root for, Artemis Fowl is actually a villain and should have portrayed as such. The Despicable Me movies have that troupe down very well.

reviews.review_title: I guess this movie is great if you are 7yo
reviews.content:
But the story is just really really confusing! I haven't read the books, and I won't.
There are so many details that they skip quickly through, and too many details that aren't needed. The viewer don't get to know the universe and magic and what not.
I won't recommend it, it seems as if they could gave made this movie into two movies.
Some great acting and some bad and annoying.

I understand that if you've read the books you might be disappointed but for those you haven't then this is a very enjoyable and entertaining film. I would ignore all the ridiculous 1 star reviews and the anti Disney brigade. Very few films deserve to get 1 star and this is certainly not one of them. I thought the young cast were charming and perfect for this type of film. I especially liked Judi dench as you've never seen her before. Unless you have huge unrealistic expectations you will enjoy this film. It's a great family film that Disney have been doing for the last 70+ years.

I've never read the book so i cannot compare the film to it but the target audience for this movie was clearly for the young-uns. it is simple to follow and has child-friendly characters, making it great for kids to watch. i will admit that the acting is basic, but it's one of those movies that you watch once for the sake of it, and i doubt that it will be anyone's favourite. i say, just watch it and make an opinion for yourself because other reviews are being too critical for a kid's film.

I gave two as it's quite pretty at points.
Barely a story.
Loud. Lots of swirling. I feel a bit sick!
I got bored quite quickly. Watched it to the end but am none the wiser.
Acting is pretty bad.
I've not read the book but from other reviews probably for the best.

Having read artemis fowl I was looking forward to this so much. The actors were well picked but my god it was so rushed and so much crammed into an hour and a half it didn't make sense and all. The film should have been at least, at the very least 2 films of the same length even 3. Disappointed
I read the book with my 9 years old and it's disappointing to say the least... garbage. One of the worst book to screen movie I've ever seen.

reviews.review_title: WHAT A HUGE MISSED OPPORTUNITY - Technical Rating: 2.5/10 My Rating: 3.5/10
reviews.content:
Artemis Fowl
Released June 12th, 2020
Disney+Starring: Ferdia Shaw, Josh Gad, Colin Farrell, Judi Dench, Nonso Anozio
Directed: Kenneth BranaghWell...sigh...huh??? I suppose when you look at all the finer details of this production from Walt Disney Studios, I have no idea why I was so surprised of the final cut that was essentially dumped (over three...THREE years after principal photography) on their streaming service over a year after their initial theatrical release date. The first teaser trailer for Artemis Fowl dropped on March 2nd, 2019. Talk about the anticipation! If I'm not mistaken, allot of the footage we saw in this teaser trailer did not even make it into the final cut of the finished product. Not really a shocker considering it was only announced that Colin Farrell was going play the role of Artemis Fowl Sr. in March of this year! After the rumours of numerous reshoots and the runtime of the final product that we had the (dis)pleasure of watching, I still didn't think that this was actually the film that we were going to get post production. I can only imagine how long the first edited version of this film would have been - compared to the final 90 minute epic failure this was! And...I didn't even read the literature for this film that I know is beloved by many fans. I feel especially sorry for everyone who actually read the source material and waited so long with such high anticipation and this was what they got.This film is an absolute mess. I am not going to get into specific details but you can tell they completely destroyed the continuity of the story during the editing process. There are soooo many gaps and plot holes in this film. I found myself rewinding sequences several times to make sure I in fact didn't miss a scene or some imortant piece of dialogue. And I am sure this goes without saying, but what the hell was Josh Gad and Dame Judi Dench thinking (or even more disturbing director Kenneth Branagh thinking with this idea of having these two talented actors portraying their versions of Christian Bale's Dark Knight - their voices were insufferable!) when rolling through each scene??? Kenneth Branagh is a fairly talented director and actor (IMDb credits include 2017's Murder on the Orient Express, 2015's live action remake of Cinderella, & Thor) and so I really expected a little more from the direction and efforts from the cast. And as badly as I feel for Ferdia Shaw and his efforts to bring beloved 12-year old diabolical genius and mastermind Artemis Fowl to the big screen, it really wasn't his fault for the failure of this movie. I truly feel sorry for him as this was literally his first acting role EVER; and it is very apparent throughout the film. I just think that with all the time this production wasted and all the choppy editing and reshoots, they would have figured out that they may have cast the wrong actor for this role. And finally, if you were to overlook the choppy editing and screenplay, poor dialogue, poor casting choices and character depictions, and massively apparent plot holes, I was at the very least hoping for a visually stunning film...let's just say some of the CGI is...to not put too fine a point on it, was distracting.Whoa...this is exactly why I didn't really want to do a review of this film. I know how much work and time and blood, sweat, and tears goes into making a film, especially with the massively high expectations of adapting a beloved novel series, and so I feel truly bad for this final product. There will be younger audience out there that can easily overlook all of the things I've mentioned and thoroughly enjoy this film, but honestly, this was a catastrophic misfire by Walt Disney Studios. They squandered a massive opportunity to create a franchise. But now, forced to dump this film on their streaming service and with such overall poor reception by practically everyone, I doubt we ever see another Artemis Fowl film.Despite how many things went wrong with this film, and I may actually never give it a second viewing, it was still nowhere close to the worst film I've seen in 2020. Gross.

Watched with the kids and it was great. I hadn't heard of this book or film and so we had no preconceptions. Kids loved it. It was pretty amusing and even funny in places. Worth watching just for Dame Judy saying 'top ov d'morning'. All this bleating about it is ridiculous. It's a film, watch it and pipe down. Other reviews are searching for artistic merit and depth somewhere it's not supposed to be. I have seen films rated 1 or 2 ( or the first few minutes) and this does not deserve ratings like that. Honestly,, probably a 6-7. Story is good, visually, you believe the trolls n fairies are real and it keeps moving along at a reasonable pace. I think the lockdown must have made the crazies crazier. Well worth giving the film a try and if you don't like it, switch it off and try to find something better. Good luck with that .

reviews.review_title: Why does everyone hate this movie ??
reviews.content:
I'd like to start with the fact that I have never read the books, in fact, I'd never even heard of Artemis Fowl until this movie came out.
A lot of the critics of this movie seem to have either read the books or expected the movie to be more adult orientated. This is a movie aimed directly at the young teen market so you can't expect it to please all the adults. As for the people who always insist on comparing movies to the books, you can't always get all the details from a book into a movie as books allow the reader to use their imagination and picture things differently than what the writer had envisaged.
Then there are the critics who say things like "it's a confusing story line" and "I couldn't follow the story", where we watching the same movie ?? I had no trouble following the story. Yes a lot of it was predictable and some of it was a bit corny, but that how these movies usually are, they are supposed to be a bit of light relief and fun. Watch it as a bit of fun and don't try and compare it to the books and you should enjoy it.
I for one would like to see a follow on or a series but judging by the ratings, I don't think there will be one.

reviews.review_title: If not the worst movie I've ever seen, maybe the 2nd worst.
reviews.content:
We chose this movie to keep our 4 years old kid entertained. He fell asleep after 20 minutes. I can't blame him
I keep repeating myself that this is a kid's movie and I shouldn't be taking it too seriously, but the director is usually a good one and some cast members are famous too, so I must judge this movie properly. And it's bad.
The story line is practically non-existent. Characters do and say random stuff at random times and even if the story is poor it's hard to follow. It seems like more than a movie this is a bunch of CGI-heavy scenes badly glued together. The climax of the film centers around a large fight with no real threat and no actual meaning.One last word about the acting. While the grown up characters are decent, the young actors are terrible. There are movies out there with a great junior cast, but here the two protagonists are just really bad, starting from the kid playing Artemis Fowl himself.

reviews.review_title: Diverges way too far from the books
reviews.content: Diverges way too far from the books. Well this movie is okay for kids it is quite boring for adults. The special effects are okay but the storyline diverts much too far away from the original books which is just annoying. It's barely good enough to waste the time watching it.

Okay... so, it's been a while since I read the books, but I remember enough to see that this movie is basically stripped of everything the book was. All that remains are the character's names. I was baffled at some of the choices the movie makers made here. Why give Holly some bogus reason of looking for her father or whatever when it would make more sense to use the original reason for why she came to the tree: to perform the ritual that restores her magic. This is what Artemis in the books knew and used to his advantage when capturing Holly. Instead he's just sitting there waiting because someone saw a fairy there once upon a time??Also, even if they chose not to make him a criminal (which defies the whole point of his story, but oh well...) they could at least have given him some brainpower. They could have showed his intelligence by having him decipher the book with the secrets of the fairies, as he did in the books. He managed to decode their language, which is why he knew all their secrets.It would have made sense to keep this sort of things in the movie when they were sticking to the overall plot anyway (like keeping most of the plot confined to the manor, the time freeze, the troll, Diggums; it's all there, just muddled beyond recognition and sense.)In the end, I think what I missed the most was the banter between the main characters, especially Mulch, Foaly and Holly. There were so many opportunities to use dialogue from the books, but instead the script writers decided to make their own, half-assed dialogue for no apparent reason.And lastly, don't get me started on how they butchered the two main characters, Artemis and Holly. They took away any personality that these two characters possessed, and left only empty husks in their place. Holly seems like a misplaced little girl while in the books she was always quick thinking and fearless, and Artemis is no mastermind and definitely not a criminal one. That sentence at the end of the movie just seems absurdly misplaced after the whole movie was spent trying to make Artemis into a good guy. Just some ordinary teenager who likes sports (wtf) and who only wants to save his father (in the books, his father is gone and his mother is sick with grief... here she's dead for no apparent reason). What made Artemis in the books a bit more relatable despite being a cynical child genius, was that he was completely hopeless when it came to physical endurance. He could barely bounce a ball. He was the brains while Holly and Butler was the muscle. So when the movie creators give him both brains and makes him an extremely skilled surfer, he becomes even farther removed from someone that a kid can relate to. He's seemingly perfect. Or at least, that's what the movie is trying to tell us.It has yet to show us any of that geniusness because seemingly, all the problems just solved themselves.
As I sit here on a Saturday night one day after the release of the film, I realize that even film is victim to this year after painfully watching this picture.

reviews.review_title: Nothing like the review of the movie on IMDB
reviews.content:
It says "young criminal prodigy, hunts down fairies to find his father", yet he does none of that.SPOILERS....In fact he really doesn't do anything in the movie. Nothing really happens except one fight scene that takes place at his mansion.1.Father goes missing, held by someone unknown
2. Fairies want an secret object that is never really explained what it is, that artemis's father has hidden in mansion
3. Fairies attack mansion to get secret object, then Artemis and faeries come to an agreement and Father is returned.
4. The End..Literally, that's all that happens. It opens by telling us how much of a genius Artemis is and yet he doesn't use his intellect in one single instance in the movie.The movie is about 1 1/2 hours long and really could have been reduced to 45 mins and the audience would still feel bored with the content presented.

I just finished this movie, and I have to say I enjoyed it, if you want to want a family movie that has enough to keep the kids entertained then this is for you. If you've ever read the books, then you may be disappointed but like I said I it's a good movie of a great book.
I think the film is really goodVery good film and I think they should make another film

reviews.review_title: As a fan of the series, I am insulted
reviews.content: This is an absolutely terrible movie adaptation of a popular teenage book series. The fans of the original "Artemis Fowl" story would be angered and downright offended by this atrocity.As for others, you can expect a terrible, cluttered story, like it was written by a 5 year old, boring characters and a thin veil of great CG, which is nearly not enough to save this worthless experience.The movie takes every aspect of the original books and twists them in a very unrecognizable way, ruining every single moment of the story.Artemis Fowl is one of those movies which absolutely no one should waste their time on, period.

I am usually a fan of Kenneth Branagh's work. This movie is the exception. I have been a fan of the books for many years and was looking forward to this movie. It didn't follow the story at all. It was a movie based on characters created by Eoin Colfer. However, unless you read the books I don't think you would understand the nature of Artemis Fowl's character. He is supposed to be a child prodigy and a criminal mastermind, but you wouldn't know it by watching the movie except Artemis has to actually state he's a criminal mastermind but never actually participates in any criminal activity or does anything to make you realize he is a mastermind.Butler is supposed to be the bad ass of all bad asses and his first name is supposed to be a secret. This guy just looks like a fat guy in a suit who is confused about what is going on around him.I could go on and on about how they ruined all the characters in this film. If I were Eoin Colfer I would be highly disappointed in how they butchered my story and very upset knowing no other movies would be made after this flop.The articles I read about Eoin's comments on how he approves of some of the changes before the movies was released were probably made as to not offend Disney to preserve future dealings.Not sure when Hollywood is going to figure out people want to see the author's story on the big screen not a director's vision of the same story.With only a few exceptions, the books are always better than the movie.

reviews.review_title: Poor, poor story-line... Special effects kind of cool...
reviews.content: This movie made no sense... Someone steals am item to prevent someone else from taking it. However, in the end they returned it right back to where it was originally, so that whoever the mystery group is can now steal it?!?!?!This *probably* could have been a good movie, if they either made it longer or broke it up into multiple movies to tell the story properly. As-is, it's just a mashed together mess that makes little sense. It's all short bits of story telling, then there's some inevitable fight scene, then everyone dusts themselves off, another story, another fight, etc, etc...
I was waiting for this move. Loved the books. I can't believe they managed to make it this bad. Why not just folllow the books. Unfortunately its a waste of time

reviews.review_title: mockery of the books and a total botch job
reviews.content: I couldn't even make it halfway. what IS this?? the characters were all unlikeable and josh gad's narration was completely unnecessary and set the tone completely wrong. my favourite bit was whenever the centaur with the ridiculous haircut ran because it was just so stupidly laughable. don't watch this unless you want the books ruined for you and lose all respect for anyone involved with this film.

This movie is awful. I've read the whole series, and I understand that there's not really any such thing as sticking to the book 100%, but this movie only used like less than 1% of the reading material. They used the names. Artemis is unrecognizable. He's supposed to be cold and calculating. He doesn't do kid stuff and he's all about staying clean. He said not the kind of person to go play in the water or ride around in the forest. Artemis' mom isn't dead in the books, Artemis' dad is already missing in the first book. I'm so angry. Disney, you are a hot pile of garbage. Don't make a second movie.I watched the rest of the movie after airing out my anger, and I'm not going to change my rating. This movie isn't even good if you don't take the books into account. The plot is bad. Artemis is probably in like 5 minutes of this movie. Why isn't this called Artemis Fowl: The Mulch Diggums story? He's in the movie more than the main character of the series. Seriously a steaming pile of crap. Avoid this movie like Covid.

9/10? Not a 9/10 with respect to per say, the first time I saw The Lord of the Rings in theater. I'm not comparing this movie to Fight Club, Saving Private Ryan, or Schindler's List. This movie delivers. Great visuals, good character development, and it's fun to watch.Many reviews stop at the 10 minute mark. Honestly? I thought about stopping myself. The lead actor is vain and unlikable. Hot take: that's the point. Artemis Fowl isn't the character you want to be. He's wildly arrogant, and respects nobody but Albert Einstein. However, this is what makes it meaningful when he sees the other characters in the movie as his peers and equals.Many people remark on how they read the book or whatever and were lost. I know we are all sitting at home, but get off your phone. I read the books so long ago I thought this was going to be another YA series "The Thief Lord". If I can figure out what's going on after thinking it was a movie about thieves in Venice, you can figure it out.This is not the usual Disney movie, and it shows. It has the occasional 'why would you do that' moment, but remember... this movie is PG. Everybody mad about ViRtUe sIgNaLiNg feels like this movie is Deadpool 3 but it's just Ryan Reynolds reading Chicken Soup for the Teenage Soul for 1.5 hours. Simmer down until you're cool enough to eat.

reviews.review_title: I so wanted this to be better
reviews.content: I haven't read the books but liked the premise, the effects budget looked decent and there are some very good actors in the cast. The first 10 minutes or so were fine, then it all started going downhill for the time being at least. Nonso Anozie playing Butler despite a decent turn in Game if Thrones apparently can no longer act his way out of a paper bag, I got splinters from just watching, elves living in sci-fi land felt clunky and was poorly realised, and to cap it all Judi Dench one of the worlds finest actors gave what must surely be a career worst performance. Ferdia Shaw and Lara McDonnell gave creditable performances in the two lead roles of Artemis Jnr and Holly, the latter in particular and the former only when not wearing shades which took away too much expression. The second half did improve considerably (and thankfully) including some much needed humour, much of it courtesy of Josh Gad who stole many but not all of the scenes in which he appeared. Overall a bit of a mess with some decent and some dreadful acting, and a second half which just about averted abject disaster. I'm sure many kids will love this but the presumed sequel will need to be much improved to persuade this viewer to re-engage.
What on earth happened here, its the avatar the last airbendder movie all over again.

reviews.review_title: 5 minutes in and I stopped watching
reviews.content:
I just couldn't.
It opens with Mulch being arrested and immediately talking about magic.
Then skips to Artemis Fowl Je (who is ridiculously NOT athletic or Physically coordinated *surfing*?!?!
Dear Disney - WTF?

Well now. You can judge it as just being a family/kids movie, and if you haven't read the books, this might be quite enjoyable. It's quite "safe". There is some nice CGI.All in all it's hard to find anything offensive at all with this movie. They made a kids-movie (and the books are not). And judging it for that would make it around a 5/10 maybe even 6/10.If you have READ the books though. You are most likely wondering what the *beep* you are watching! Not much is done right I'm afraid! I'm not going to list everything wrong. Just be warned if you are a fan of the books, you will not like what they have done here!This should never had been made as movie, unless they really did a movie chronologically (which they definitely did not!) of book one and the move forward with a new movie for book two and so on.
Or, and I really wish they had gone this way, they should have made this a series on either of the streaming platforms.
With a decent budget this could have been a fantastic show I believe!The best char in the movie is by far Lara McDonnell as Holly Short. In fact she is the only one that feels right for the role, and her performance is on point. So hats of to her.

reviews.review_title: CGI looked nice rest but rest did not impress
reviews.content: I like computer effects but the movie was compiled from random ideas put together. Short introduction for every character did not help either overall watching for just the effect is ok.

Artemis Fowl is clearly in the lowest tier of Disney productions, and we now know why it was released to Disney+ instead of held for cinema release in 2021. It's just a bad movie that barely acknowledges the source material.For those in Ireland, the opening is even borderline insulting. Mulch is apprehended by the Irish Police (the Gardai) and is interrogated by...wait for it...British Intelligence? This would never happen in real life since Ireland won its independence from Britain quite a long time ago. This goes beyond mere stupidity to the sort of uncaring plot hole that betrays the level of care that goes into this movie. The Hill of Tara, an actual real physical place in Ireland, does not have a mysterious tree either. Sorry. As for surfing...well, let's all just agree that Disney and Geography separated during the production of Artemis Fowl :). They also separated themselves from the books.If you can ignore the plot holes, lack of consistency to the books, the coincidences, the thoroughly unconvincing presentation of Artemis' intelligence, and a few poorly executed set pieces, it's still not a complete disaster. It's entertaining enough for the kids...who have not read the books.
If you can forget everything you know about the books, it's still a pretty awful film...

reviews.review_title: How to ruin a great book
reviews.content: OH THE HORROR!! I am a big Artemis Fowl fan, read all of them with my kids. How could they do this? This really is an abomination. I think the only thing that was worse was CATS. Wait...did that star Judi Dench too?
It is good story. Good game. Not any expectations our family had, and had good time! Just relax and enjoy it! We liked it!

Not having read the books this was my first introduction to Artemis Fowl. And after sitting through this I still don't know anything about the character. Alas despite lengthy periods of exposition (poor Josh Gad having to deliver reams of the stuff in close up straight into camera) it wasn't clear why anybody was behaving the way they were, because the script felt like it was written as a box ticking exercise by a committee. What a shame. I really liked the design (although why the fairy troops were wearing Adidas cricket helmets back to front was a mystery) and some of the sequences were directed with flair. The performances were universally OK; young Ferdia Shaw was no worse than anyone else, but with no plot or character development nobody stood much of a chance. It was all too frenetic. I fear young Mr Fowl will be joining Alex Rider as a young adult film series that never was.

Felt like a made for TV flick or straight to video release. Pointless characters that add nothing to a very thin story. A bad guy that serves no purpose. A hero boy that you never feel a connection with. The fairy girl was the only redeeming character that kept this review from being a 1. Please Disney don't waste time making a sequel to this.

reviews.review_title: A Contender For The Worst Film Of All Time
reviews.content: The headline says it all. This is an absolute stinker of a film.Having never read the books, I knew nothing about Artemis Fowl before watching the film and now having watched it, I'm still none the wiser. Not because this is a complicated film but because the story this is basically just a 90-minute collection of scenes that have been randomly thrown together, often with poor quality CGI thrown over the top of it.This isn't helped by the wooden and poorly developed characters. Josh Gad is unbearable as the films narrator, grating through numerous already tedious scenes with a frankly dreadful put on accent. You can tell Lara McDonnell is trying her best in the role of Holly Short but she's given nothing to work with here and it shows. The script is just awful. Quiet why Judy Dench and Colin Farrell felt compelled to star in this I really don't know.And I don't like ripping on a kid just starting out in their career but the performance of Ferdia Shaw is dreadful and up there with one of the worst I've ever seen. He has no charisma or personality as Artemis and gives one of the most unlikeable performances I've seen in a lead role of a film, and I include films in that where you are supposed to dislike the lead character. Was this really the best actor Disney could find for the role?If you've got 90 minutes to spare and don't know what to do with it, staring at the wall would be a better use of your time then watching this would be.

reviews.review_title: I Feel Bad For Eoin Colfer
reviews.content:
Well, the costume designs were okay; and the actors who played Artemis and Holly weren't terrible choices (although I feel like they should have aged Artemis up to being 15-16 or waited until these actors were a bit older), but those are really the only positive things I can say about this movie. Stuff from the books happens, but it's buried under a bunch of unnecessary and bad changes and twisted around to the point that it's close to nonsensical. This was a great book series and there was a point when I was younger that I even considered it my favorite book series ever; but it's so altered and watered down here that it loses everything that made the series good. Artemis Fowl's character arc from villain to hero was great and probably the first arc like it that I saw in a series as a kid; but here he comes across like a ripoff Harry Potter with all character development and nuance cast aside in favour of a blatantly heroic protagonist. Kenneth Branagh is great at acting and he can do faithful adaptations (such as his awesome and incredibly faithful version of Hamlet), but it seems like he either didn't put any effort into this movie, or he just thought that having the title character start off as a villain would be too hard for kids to understand, so he made a watered down version of what was a reasonably complex story (at least in terms of childrens and young adults literature). Or maybe it's all Disney's fault and not his, I don't know. Regardless, this is garbage and I feel bad for Eoin Colfer. I know some people were able to enjoy it and so I guess good for them, but I doubt many of those people would still enjoy it if they read the book version.
The Percy Jackson movies were more faithful adaptations than this, honestly.

reviews.review_title: Makes The Last Airbender movie look good
reviews.content: I've seen better 'adaptations' of existing work on Wattpad.

Most of the movie you are left wondering what is going on and why it is happening, the actions og the characters seems unmotivated and vague at best.You get the sense that driften characters have driften abilities do to their species, but most of the time it feels underutilized and ill exsplained.Cool magic!... There is magic? Are there risk? How does it work? Why not use it more?The genius kid... Who we barely see show of his genius throughout the movieAll in all i found this movie confusing and lacking a clear structure

reviews.review_title: Obviously did not read the series just Cliff Notes
reviews.content: I knew it would be horrible when the movie starts with Artemis surfing. Yes, Artemis Fowl, criminal mastermind, all brain and barely enough brawn to walk across a room SURFING. He wears jeans and t-shirts. They destroyed everything interesting about the character, gutted the story and sanitized everything. The only thing they got sort of right was Mulch Diggums. So incredibly disappointing.

reviews.review_title: As a fan of the books...
reviews.content:
The casting well done. It seems like the screen writer... I'm not sure what they did. But it had nothing to do with reading the books.It comes down to this:
If it were Theater released I would have preordered the tickets for opening night. Then waited too long for good seat. And ten minutes into the show I would have left to ask for a refund.

I didn't read the books, so I have nothing to compare this to. I thought this was a decent action-fantasy movie. It had enough creatures in it for me to be satisfied. Artemis was a tad flat as a character, but Holly the fairie was very good. The interaction between the characters was decent. A solid 7 star movie.

This is a Disney movie, not the domain of bookworms or internet nerds. It's a fun production with great acting from Lara McDonnell who is the standout performance with her part 'Holly'. Like a fairy Superheroine she saves the day, Artemis could do with a better actor as he is a little wooden. Look forward to a Holly spin off.

So, let me start this by saying that I am a huge fan of the series. It was the first series I ever read, so it holds a very special place in my heart. I had huge expectations for this film going into it.The changes of Root and Trouble's characters to females I wasn't a huge part of, but ultimately didn't negatively impact the story or Holly's character arc. Juliet is now Butler's niece instead of his sister, but again, their close relationship is still there. So while I wasn't a fan of the changes, they are what they are and suit the movie. I didn't like the removal of Avangeline Fowl (in the books she is alive, in the movie she has passed away) but it is what it is.The trailers don't do the movie justice, and makes the film look subpar- however the movie was absolutely brilliant.I'll get the things I like out of the way first before I move on to things I didn't like.I really liked the combined storyline of the first and second books, it worked really well.The inclusion of Opal as the antagonist of the first movie was interesting, but really paid off. It worked and introduced her character well.Kenneth's direction was awesome, there was an element of homely movie with the perfect sprinkle of magic. It was quite captivating.Josh Gad enthralled me as Mulch, absolute perfect casting. His comedic timing and the bickering was on point!Ferdia Shaw was excellent as Artemis, he really captured the character. Although I don't know why they made him athletically active, from what I remember in the books he wasn't that gifted when it came to running/fighting. But it works with the movie. I just wish they made him more.... evil, like the books. Book Artemis is quite devious and the movie was missing the devious spark that he had.Lara McDonnell was gorgeous as Holly Short, perfect choice!Nikesh Patel was awesome as Foaly, funny as well as intellectual- the perfect Foaly!
Nonso Anozie was sensational as the Butler we all know and love, really bringing the character to life.The inclusion of Colin Farrell as Artemis Fowl Senior was actually really heartwarming. Their relationship made Artemis somewhat more relatable.Judi Dench as Commander Root just felt....off. Not because of her, she was brilliant, but because Commander Root is a male, and has a lot of quirks that were missing from the film. Dench brought her own flare, however, I just wished she hadn't have gone with the growl-like voice that she had. Maybe it was an attempt to make her seem tough, to make fans more accepting of the change of Root from male to female, but it just didn't work. But, if they were going to cast any actress and a gender-bent Root, Dench was a great choice.Now, the things I didn't like.I really don't like that Artemis and Holly bonded over their fathers. It felt like the Superman/Batman/Martha trope, if you know what I'm talking about).It really would have been nice for the movie to be longer, so they could include more of the story from each of the books. The character development felt very, very fast- as did the friendship development between Holly and Artemis. It felt very forced.All in all, I really enjoyed this film. Fans of the books will enjoy it, I think. It holds it's own without ruining the magic and integrity of the source material (looking at you, The Last Airbender). Give it a try!

All I can say is I wish that I'd read the other reviews here before wasting my time watching this nonsense.

In the first Artemis Fowl book, even I'll admit, not very much happens. It all amounts to a novel length, day-long sting operation.What ultimately makes it work, however, is merely the complexity in simple plumbing. What makes it work is being able to see the development and thought processes of this child prodigy, and seeing how we get from his introduction to a life or death standoff between him and a magical militia (and furthermore how he succeeds in his own devious ways).In regards to the Artemis Fowl movie, I get the impression that there was someone probably higher up the creative wrung than director Kenneth Branagh (who happens to be a very competent director) who didn't trust that this franchise was strong enough to get by on merely that. It shows with how unnecessarily dense the movie was.From beginning to end, the titular Artemis Fowl is touted to be this super genius, but from memory I can only really remember him doing two or three things that displayed who he really was (if even that). The rest of the movie flew by with about an hour and twenty minutes of force fed narration (side-bar: is it just me or does Josh Gad try to upstage every movie that he is in?), elements from the sequels jammed into the plot, quite a few important plot devices thrown out the window, and ten times more than your daily dose of action that would make Michael Bay's 'Transformers' movies look bland by comparison. By all accounts, it is the cinematic equivalent of dangling keys over your baby for an hour and a half. If the movie was half an hour longer and took time to BREATHE AND REFLECT then maybe it could have worked (and also by omitting half of the inclusions).For what it's worth, I felt like the acting and overall design of the movie were really good. I didn't even mind some character changes (like Artemis being more athletic and emotional). It's only unfortunate that these details were colossally overshadowed by everything else.I'm generally very forgiving when it comes to adaptations of books because it's nearly impossible to please everybody on a good day. But it's sad when you take a step back and realize that the minutes long trailer was better than the movie it was advertising.

After dinner, we crashed on the sofa, excited for this new Disney creation. Me, my 7 yo son and my wife. Twenty minutes later, my wife was sleeping, I was trying to understand how did they mess this movie up so badly, and my son... well... he's 7, and every special effect is pure joy. That's it. Luckily we watched it on Disney Plus, not in theater. So, the waste of money is not worth to mention, but no one is going to give us back 90 minutes of astonishing cinematic disaster. Everything went wrong with this picture.

reviews.review_title: The film that had a troubled production history
reviews.content: This film has been in development hell for years, and I mean years. Studios have been trying to make this film since 2001. Now before going into the review, let's point out that Disney managed to bring the film out of development hell, so you should at least give them some credit for trying.Pros: The Visuals were stunning, it had excellent acting from supporting actors, it also had an understanding relationship between humanity and the mystical beings that are in hiding (Even though it was horribly explained).Cons: The over reliance on visuals made the film seem fake at some parts. I understand that the studio did everything they could to make a fantastic film, but they spent too much money on visuals, too little on a compelling plot. Just because a film is filled with state of the art visuals doesn't mean it will garantee a financial and critical success. Ahem, Transformers and its sequels. The main protagonist was just annoying, and I mean he cannot act annoying. When I rewatched the film, I skipped every scene that heavily focused on the main character. Keep in mind, it's a 1.5 hour film, and that didn't even help it. The other actors did a great job. Bravo! They were great in the film. The plot is also spliced from two books in the series, making the film into a convoluted mess. I can tell a lot was cut on the editing floor, and while editing a really long film can help make it a critical darling, depending on what gets cut out, whoever edited this film did terrible. The editors did worse than those on Transformers: The Last Knight. And that is not a good sign. The series is also gritty and dark, not exactly the Disney route. They shouldn't have made the film to begin with. Hopefully this taught Disney a lesson, if they want to make a dark and gritty book series into a franchise in the foreseeable future.I really wanted to like the film, but it was so bad.Also, the Pandemic didn't really help the film as well, which would not have really done any damage to the film because of how bad it is, but it did help Disney financially by having it on Disney+. Good Job on them for that.

reviews.review_title: Not even close to the feeling from the books
reviews.content: As a young teenager i read all the books in this series, right when every book came out. From what i can remember over 15 years later, this is some mix from first and 4th book.There is a whole magical world to introduce and explain. This movie is way to short to handle it. It felt very rushed and not enough time were spent to explain things.The effects were nice, as modern movies cand make. Its Disney after all.Personalitywise, Artemis Fowl felt nothing like the books, too geeky somehow. Don´t know if its because of the actor or the script, but he has to have a more arrogant personality. And also again, needs more time to explain how he is as smart as he is.Holly short is more mature in the books, she is not as old as she looks after all.So overall, felt like a bad attempt at a great series of books. Maybe because of a limited budget.

For a company like Disney to destroy a storyline is nothing new. Next time, take a couple of weeks to actually study the books. Nake notes and stay true to it.
I get that some things must change to fit the entire thing in to a movie. Harry Potter was a huge success (I hate J. K. Rowling for the bigot she is), this could have been too had they made the effort.
I don't know anything about the books so therefore I could not compare. I did enjoy the movie and hopefully look forward to maybe a follow up.

reviews.review_title: Why can't they leave a classic alone??
reviews.content: I really thought Disney would know better. Look at the real successes like Harry potter, Lord of the rings etc. What do they have in common? they stick to the story that the extremely gifted authors wrote. That is what captured peoples imagination. they stuck to the original and added great artistic special effects, inspired Direction and the right talents doing the acting. This movie tried to get by on its name, one great actress, and special effects. They sacrificed the magical element that the author had inspired and produced a predictable piece of high calorie, sugary rubbish that's been shoved out so many times before. We, the thinking public look for the translation of our beloved classics to be as true to the story as is possible and enhanced by the producers not just an expensive light show.

I don't know what it is about Hollywood, movies seem to be getting worse these days. Hollywood producing any rubbish and bad writers I guess. I'm sure a lot of work went into this movie. The costumes were good. But that's about it. There was no character development in the first 20 minutes I watched. The acting was very very poor.I'd recommend Darby OGill and the Little People. reviews.review_title: Didn't read the books, but hated it anyway!
reviews.content:
I like the genre, it's from Disney, big budget and it has some good names in the cast... I would be very disappointed if I had not checked the ratings on IMDB first. What a bad movie with a lot of potential! The graphics were good. But the story, lines, music... just terrible!!! No suspense, no character building, illogical moments... It could have been an Harry Potter franchise if I read all the positive reviews about the books. But the movie sucks big time. This is what I made up from the movie after watching it forcefully spread over three nights (spoilers alert!):Super smart rich arrogant surfdude kid Artemis, with no mother, learns that the stories from his father about a secret fantasy world of elves, trolls, kobolts, etc are not just stories. His father is kidnapped by some bad guy in a cave, whom wants some magic weapon thing, that is important as the sun, as ransom within 24 hours from Artemis. Artemis has a mastermind briljant plan: he kidnapps an Elf that by coincidence is on the right time on the right place and is also the daughter of the elf that the father of Artemis knows really good. What are the odds?! They become best friends (Stockholm syndrome maybe?!) An whole fleet of elves come to rescue the elf by:1. Creating a time loop thing around the house that eats elves?!
2. Sending in a dwarf that steals the magic thing from Artemis his own house (?!) and gives it to Artemis because they are also suddenly best buddies.
3. Sending in a troll that destroys everything in his path. Also the elf they came to rescue could die by it.They defeat the troll. Artemis his elf friend uses her magic and the magic thing to beam Artemis father up. Then they want revenge. The dwarf is in superguarded prison on purpose and tells this whole story. Nobody knows why. Artemis rescues dwarf. Film ends.
Absolutely terrible. I have no idea what they thought they were doing with this film.

The action is hasty. You don't have time to feel anything. The movie is boring, the only think I liked was the idea. I didn't read the books and after that movie I don't think I will read them ever. I don't recomand it.

His greatest weapon is his mind.Butler is black!? Ok I'm all for all these recasts and what not. There needs to be a line drawn sometimes.Commander Root is a woman!?

reviews.review_title: A teen action movie with the fairy world, but the teen is not Artemis.
reviews.content:
I love movies. I love books. I love Disney. So I had high hopes when Disney made a movie from a book series I liked. What could go wrong? A lot, apparently.
I don't need the movie to be a carbon copy of the book to like it. Some stuff that works in books does not work on screen and movies can create the visual spectacular and action sequence that books can't do as well. Problem is when they choose to make a movie based on a book, take the heart of the story and then completely mangle it. Disney could have taken a perfectly good recipe and turn it into gold, even create their own storyline for Artemis's next adventure, but they choose to remove what makes the books a classic which are the characters and how they develop.
I quickly realised in the first 10 minutes that it's not going to be at all like the book. Visually, it's great. Ireland is beautiful. Haven is suitably high-tech. The action sequence is fun. They changed the characters and some of it works. Foaly is now a snappy dresser. Root is Judi Dench, but hey, why not? Mulch is funny and now a giant dwarf (guess they really really want Josh Gad to play it and then ran out of money to make him small). They made Butler and Artemis Sr more people-friendly and family-oriented, which I guess I can let go. Holly Short now has a backstory.
Koboi is apparently Darth Vader now (so not a surprise if she is going to be Artemis' mother or closely related to it) because you know, let's make it really obvious she's a villain... a cute girly pixie apparently just doesn't cut it.
Main problem is Artemis is just not Artemis in this Disney version, and it's very difficult to move away from that if you've read and loved the books. In the books, Artemis was a gazillionaire genius kid, super-formal and exacting but socially awkward and clumsy, who is also a loyal brilliant strategist and mastermind trying to save his father, then mother, then the fairy world. Disney mixed a bit of Alex Rider in and deleted quite a bit of Artemis Fowl and made him a gazillionaire supersmart rude teen, who can now fight and shoot, trying to save his father. So like any other teen action movie, with leprechauns, fairies, dwarfs and trolls thrown in.
It's probably a good movie for young kids, who don't care for dialogue or character development, and like pretty pictures on screen. Probably not if the kid is a fan of the book and the characters.
Maybe I need to watch the movie again and pretend I've never read the book. Right now, it kinda still pisses me off they made Artemis wear a T-shirt and sneakers!
So boring it put my 7 year old to sleep... I don't know why but I forced myself to finish it.

Had to stop watching after 20 minutes because it was too painful, having read the books it actually hurts seeing this film, they changed the whole concept of who Artemis is, now hes a hip teen who surfs and uses guns, the real Artemis detests physical exercise and in any physical altercations he is helpless without Butler

reviews.review_title: If I could give it a 0 I would.
reviews.content: Not even close to making it similar to the books. I was excited that they were making a movie out of the books but ended up being so disappointed. The characters' personality were all completely different, didn't even try to make it similar.

It stars Colin Farrell (In Bruges, Dumbo etc), Nonso Anozie (Zoo, Enders Game etc) and judi Dench (Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, Casino Royale etc) as recognisable stars with newcomers thrown in for good mix but falls desperately flat for a Disney movie

reviews.review_title: Feels like a made for TV movie...but worse.
reviews.content: Let me start off by saying I never read the books, but I thought I'd check this out as I heard good things from my younger siblings. If this movie is any indication I will not be reading the books lol.The dialogue is crying AF, the story really doesn't deliver on any metric and as weird as this sounds...and hour and thirty minutes just doesn't do this movie justice. I can't help but feel it is rushed.If they added and hour to develop the story and make me care about the characters I might be more invested.I would suggest a complete remake and actually develop the story and fill out the characters.
